w3hLFIK-dBkjTd4NtugHsg.text: Went to Il Bosco last night for the first time and was not disappointed!  The Joanna pizza was delicious.  Can't wait to go back and try the other pizzas :)

hmyValnQs89nPV6iYYsFxg.text: The food is EXCELLENT!  We have been 5 times now, and everything we have had has been delicious!  We will continue to dine w Bill and IL Bosco!  The Caprese is AWESOME!

aPHVBj2E6qxcg0dIZLI9DQ.text: Il Bosco is an excellent little restaurant and pizzeria.   warm, fun decor.  the food is fantastic.   the food on the menu is fresh and creative.  the owner, Bill Forrest, has a very personal touch and oversees it all quite well.  it is a hidden gem in Scottsdale but once you know where it is you will go back again and again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

-LV9tz1gmUt6afcyVgUhrA.text: This East Coast girl was a very happy camper after our visit to Il Bosco! (we have high pizza standards where I come from).  We were group of 5 in town on business. Our original plan was Romo, but the 1-1/2 hour wait deterred us and we found Il Bosco and what a find it was! The atmosphere was comfortable and casual. The owner was very attentive with a great sense of humor. All good, but nothing compared to the quality of the food. From the delicious olives and bread with seasoned olive oil that got us started, to the fresh salad and finally to four of the best pizzas! We tried white and red; all had perfectly thin crusts with the right amount of dough around the edge and each was topped with wonderfully fresh cheese or other inventive ingredients. Exquisite!  The party didn't end there - we finished off with lemon sorbetto which just perfect and the youngest members of our group had the stamina for the pumpkin brownie.  We all decided when we left dinner that this place was going to get a return visit on our next business trip.

VSKbygUf97-t58HspYu6Ng.text: WOW!!! I see why this is the highest rated restaurant in 85260!!  I am super picky about pizza. I had Bianco, Grimaldis, pomo and on. None compare to this. MOST of those places that make brick oven pizza are too thin, the sauce bleeds thru in minutes and does not reheat well. This place has the best pizza of this kind I have had.  Not thin in the middle, amazing quality cheese!  Also got the meatball appetizer. 3 meatballs with marinana sauce, easily the best meatballs I have ever had. Not over seasoned or weird tasting.

photos.caption: Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. ADRIANNA hold the basil, YUMM!!

r4jQaFwO2Uf16V0DPxYXuQ.text: Great pizza cooked in a coal fire oven.  Light crust, great ingredients and they wait till you get there to fire the pizzas.  Perfection!  What I would love to see is a Margherita with bufalo mozzarella on the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

d-cmvlCl3zQNXNKHYctzqA.text: Delicious food, excellent beverages, and employees that become your friends during dining experience!

xnUjd1Yl5J4-6ezV3-z3MA.text: Amazing. Great service - unbelievable sauce. Had the caesar with meatballs to start. Half pepperoni pizza with the kids. So good!

48Neix4XE_GpEWQGomRVQg.text: Great little spot. Service is killer. Great variety of unique pies. Or traditional if you want. You can tell they use the best and freshest ingredients. In all honesty, I can't believe there isn't a line out the door.

GD3SPnHCgke_zughqc5CcA.text: We loved Il Bosco, we sat out on their patio with a heater and it was perfect.  The owner was so helpful in accommodating a group of 7 on a Saturday night, and provided great recommendations.  We had appetizers, salads, and pizza, and all were wonderful.  Don't miss the sausage stuffed peppadews or the caprese salad, the Caesar was great too.  We ordered 5 different pizzas thinking we would have plenty to take home, but it was so good we went home with 3 spare pieces lol.  Two thumbs up, wonderful find.

KSoV00tLh0xDSgFqvjxIDg.text: Not sure if I'm too happy I order a pizza 37min before I arrive and the place is empty and they are just finishing making my pizza to put it in the oven? I sure hope it taste as good as the wait time?

K2jZbtCmWFejfLgrasOxJA.text: I love finding little Phoenix gems. il Bosco did not disappoint. There were fresh herbs growing on the patio and wood being put in the fire. The menu was very small, but the prices were good for the size of the pizzas. You could tell that the pizza ingredients were fresh and top notch. The place is very small but feels cozy.

hALpkfAeoQmWVkJw1lc-rA.text: Best pizza I've had since I moved to Phoenix six years ago. Super friendly staff very friendly and the best part of it all is it is family owned. In addition to the pizza we had the caprese which was delicious and the creme brulee. Definitely a must if in the area!

C3VDcrYvgDh2eAWd1yHxQQ.text: Il Bosco has the best pizza in town! My go to place for my pizza fix. Bill is wonderful and always makes me feel welcome, and part of the family. Do not hesitate to make this your go to pizza place as well. You won't be disappointed. I have never had a bad meal here.

apdxwhINENAIilioM__OEA.text: I absolutely love pizza. I would have it for every meal if my family would let me. This place has amazing pizza and the service to match. It is very small so you might have to wait for a table or have to eat at the bar but the food is definitely worth it.

gPvySLLyXhpMB-MrdC1tvA.text: Checked this place out last night, and I thought it was great. Everyone who worked there was really nice, pizzas came out pretty quick, and food was great! Atmosphere was also really cute & the patio is decorated nicely.

photos.caption: Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cute ambiance, great pizzas!!

dhgQwbKnG1fbKrHSXHM4WA.text: Really excellent thin crust pizza. Salads were good but not great. Very cozy and friendly ambiance.

UcFuQvgv01sTBd83zFJPjQ.text: This place was great! Pizza was absolutely delicious and the atmosphere was amazing. The setting was perfect for an intimate evening with my partner and his mother

j_UsTBdx9TrM4EMPF1mx7Q.text: I booked Il Bosco wood-fired pizza oven for my daughter's bridal shower. It was a huge hit! The guests raved about the amazing, authentic pizza. Excellent customer service from beginning to end! Highly recommend booking them for your event or going to their restaurant and eating on their quaint patio.

5RsdEzrd4AIXWZdeGn8NMg.text: I am an Italian who has travelled the world and has been a high level chef for 40 years. This is "hands down, the best pizza"! I judge pizza on 3 things: crust, sauce and cheese. Il Bosco is the only place that I have awarded 5 stars to all 3.  Extremely quaint & charming. I love that it is kind of hidden. My only suggestion would be for more consistent, knowledgeable service staff.

IvVBss3DQCc78Blwyexjew.text: Some of he best pizza I've ever had. The atmosphere is amazing and makes you feel as though in you're in Italy. The owner came to our table and gave us personal recommendations. This is a hidden gem!

bkjGzHwnnA5sZawTlZioXA.text: Wow..  Amazing wood fired pizza.  The owner was very friendly and nice.  Hand thrown pie.  So delicious daily specials on pizzas.  Caprasi salad with fresh mozzarella.  Stone ground bread with very tasty Italian olives on the table. We felt like we were in Italy.  Well worth a try.

mbnOGA7B3IueAjCpC1tXwQ.text: The food is really good.  Pizzas are baked in wood ovens.  There is a smokey taste profile that differentiates the flavors from other places.  We got there early in the evening so seating was not a problem.  The staff was very pleasant.  They knew the menu and offered suggestions that were helpful.  We would definitely go back.

qbVi8p1h1jsE7ELruHZr-Q.text: Really good, fresh pizza. Very small inside but seems family owned and the staff is super nice and really take care of you. Fried ravioli is also great.

pdAiTYL-sLHexMfHBkN5Ew.text: Excellent pizza, service and reasonably priced. We will be back again to this hidden gem. We found it quite by accident and I am glad we did. Just the smell of the wood fired oven was worth the trip. Watch out for the serrano peppers growing outside, they have a bite!

G7oEkBq8eHIN_5SZ9KdhYg.text: This is a tiny place that does an excellent job with Pizza.  The owner is friendly and involved with greeting and making sure that you are enjoying your meal and your time in the restaurant.  My wife split the roasted vegetables and a Caesar salad.  The vegetables were terrific, the salad was the only miss of the night.  We were expecting more and will skip it next time.  There will definitely be a next time as the pizza was terrific, great crust and flavorful.  Near Scottsdale Rd and Shea, find your way to this place.

cK3CSJRBaRajzOEGkQU_dg.text: Went here for dinner after finding it on Yelp (or course). The food was good. We got the pizza with the figs and arugula (sp?) on it and it was delicious. The owner was friendly but maybe a little too friendly. It's hard to eat when someone is trying to talk to you the whole time. We had 1 slice of the pizza left and asked for a box. He took it to box it up. Finally when we paid and were wanting to leave we asked for our box and it turns out the food got thrown out instead of boxed up. No big deal since it was just 1 slice but if it had been more we definitely would have asked for another pizza to replace it.

fiTQp550Jc8W95PMUVNv7A.text: A friend told me about this place, saying it has the worlds best pizza! She had taken her food to go, but I went and ate on the enchanting patio. It is a very charming place that made me want to stay there all night eating and talking. I had one of their specialty pizzas. It was absolutely delicious! Our server was very nice. There was another male server, Zach, who stopped to help and chat with us. He was such a doll, and went above and beyond any service expected from a waiter. I will absolutely go back. What's even more exciting is that in a couple weeks they are will be offering brunch as well! With the chefs taste palate for the unique combination of tastes- I can't wait to try more!

2KBKVEattdAQ1BASNiSjCg.text: Awesome restaurant! The pizza is so delicious and the service was fabulous! Judith was such a fun waitress and Bill (the owner) was very attentive and extremely friendly. Would go back in a flash.

xnRmuAF8Tg3mzBFHRxC4Bw.text: It is not often that you run across a hidden gem such as this during the weekly business travels.  Today I did just that.  I stumbled into Il Bosco Pizza in Scottsdale, AZ.  I was greeted at the door by the owner/ Bill Forrest.  I received nothing but wonderful hospitality throughout my dining experience from both Bill and Barbara as well as some entertaining dialog with the kitchen team (a penquin tattoo, really?). The wine list was well thought out with very reasonable by the glass and bottle prices.  The menu selection was focused.  By that I mean, it stayed True to what they do and they do it well.  Too often you find the restaurant that wants to be everything to everybody.  Not here.  They do pizza very well.  I have traveled to Italy many times in my career and this place nails it.  Great dough coupled with the finest of ingredients, prepared in a minimalist style that lets the food do the talking.  I am truly impressed.  I will be back often.  I hope for Bill and Barbara that this is a hit but deep down I love the hidden gem.   If you are a foodie and love food without pretense, you will love Il Bosco.  This is a foodie find.  I am a chef and I absolutely love this place.  You will not be disappointed.   Cheers,

07xBCfpSms-xhuQ9_bsQuQ.text: The very best italian pizza in Phoenix, we take everyone that comes to town here. Yum! Try the biaggia

r0AqEiOdfGKHmjPS4ptCkA.text: The owner is sooo nice and friendly! He makes you feel welcomed! While the restaurant is small, the food is INCREDIBLE! When I close my eyes and take a bite of the pizza, I feel like I am in Italy! Even charging for the bread reminds me of Italy and for this place, I am OK with that,

zq6ob3nQRJQpN1UQ61p7bg.text: Best pizza in Scottsdale! Authentic and quick with good service.

gBmWKYvn_xvtEFEVsi-UqQ.text: Have loved this restaurant since the first time I ever ate here. I own a salon in the area and can say that Il Bosco is responsible for feeding us multiple days out of the week. Love the changing specials and charm of the quaint atmosphere. Staff is friendly and accommodating, but not overly intrusive. Love the caprese panini and the biaggo pizza! All the food is extremely fresh and always tasty.

LIbRNgINwd9GNi2o9sv3AA.text: Great place. Pizza and dessert were both amazing.  The atmosphere and staff were very homey and inviting. We will be going back.

jneg_mOoyAFxCzjBeAhacQ.text: Excellent.  Get the borrata appetizer.  I've had it at a few places here since moving from San Francisco but nothing seemed to compare to SF.  They nailed it!  Pizza was very tasty and the place has a great feel to it.  Great for a date.  A little challenging if you have kids.  It's small and tables are close together.  Might be able to sit on the patio if you have a few little ones.

p6IZSyMO_XegKp2EYY6aHA.text: Absolutely the best pizza!  Salads, meatballs, olives...you name it - everything is 5 stars here.

I8EeDoS5tE5IlOtynNpd-A.text: Wonderful little spot where you could blink and miss it if you don't know where you're going.  Pizza's are as authentic a Neapolitan style as you will get in Arizona.  Small, simple menu that won't overwhelm, great service, cozy atmosphere...... Worth the trip!

F151OCmAN7u1LIlo4LrHyw.text: We will absolutely be going back! I had the patate pizza, my son had the mussels  and my husband had a pizza that had sausage and peppers on it (sorry I can't remember the name of that one). Seriously good food, all the way around. Normally we are Pita Jungle nuts and we will always love that place, too -- but now there's a wonderful alternative next door. GREAT JOB GUYS!

SnX5iCSwh4_hz65d97pd6g.text: We were welcomed by Bill the moment we walked into this cute pizzeria. The caprese  salad was outstanding as were the meatballs. I had the prosciutto, fig, and goat cheese pizza. Amazing. Give this place a try. You will be happy you did.

PkQpou1q3VJsaOWaRUNYWw.text: My husband and I stopped here for dinner this evening, after reading several rave reviews on yelp.  We were not disappointed!  We had the Carmela and Joanna pizzas, both of which were fantastic.  In my husband's words, the crust/ topping combination was "orgasmic." We'll definitely be back again!

-MKEFA0d0ACSiqAeQSgIIw.text: I'm a huge fan of rustic, delicious pizza and Il Bosco is "winning"!  In the same style as Pizzaria Bianco and Pizza-a-Metro, this place is small, intimate and does pizza the best way.   Totally worth the visit.

rCdd6qKtBkU6bx1Tkk9PIw.text: Very cute (small) neighborhood restaurant. Amazing specials in addition to the already amazing menu. Pizza is to die for.  They had a special pizza that was a white pizza, which usually I wouldn't order but this one had bacon and an egg on top. AMAZING! Toasted ravioli appetizer was also amazing. Friendly staff and very fast service. Great place to take out pizza as well. I will be back!

cRPaJREVns-lLpI9l_U5Ww.text: Great dinner!! 15 years in the f&b business and this will be my most favorite spot going forward. Everything from the house brined olives to the amazing pizzas. Everything has the authentic touch were missing in Scottsdale. We will be back so often

kxbPqDTZ3IjxBRazuNqd5Q.text: Great, intimate wood fired pizza place. Delicious crust and simple well balance ingredients. The focus is a top notch, simple delicious pie. Wine is served in water glasses, just like growing up in an Italian household. Owner Bill is almost always there with a friendly welcome. The staff is attentive, friendly and casual. Small 5 seat bar that puts you basically in the kitchen... love it. 5 stars! Come here you will not be disappointed. Oh nice big patio also.

g-2EcgFLEp__5MMoKQO9-A.text: Great pizza! Love the crust! Have been here 3 times and have not been disappointed. And to top it off the service is as good if not better than the food!

24Y__csEoOSRC-v0lWSqYw.text: Awesome pizza!!  Everything we tried was authentic & delicious and bonus - Friendly owner & great service!! We will be back as regulars.

Ax-PS_Q9DoizVtKQWNjPNQ.text: I've had Bosco's bookmarked for a few years and never had a chance to try this place. Decided to give this place a go today and boy have I really missed out on a really good place. Shame shame on me.   It's a small place that is somewhat hidden but we had no problem finding it. They have a decent amount of outdoor seating but indoor is quite small. About seven or eight tables. Very homie with a long wooden bench on one side with throw pillows all over the bench making it very homie. Most of the tables are two people tables but they do push the tables together for bigger parties. They also have an open kitchen. I think it's has a really nice ambiance. Somewhat loud cause everyone's enjoying their food.   Well, we were started off with some tasty olives and sour dough bread which I thought was really good. Olives weren't to sour and very tasty. We ordered the Roasted Seasonal Vegetables with Burrata. Today's veggies were Brussel Sprouts. My favorite. Very fresh and really tasty. Really loved it. The Burrata was lite and really went well with the Brussel sprouts. Really good dish.   Next, we got the Lucia pizza which had sausage and mushrooms. My wife was a little worried it was going to be salty but it wasn't. Sausage was fresh and really good. Mushrooms were really fresh. All the ingredients were really fresh. It was a good sized pizza and the crust. I enjoyed the crust. It was not too thin and not to thick. A little chewy but everything came together. It was a really good pizza. Probably the best I've had on this side of town.   For dessert, they have so many choices and the owner recommended the Lemon Sorbetto. It had lemon sorbet in a real lemon frozen. I was really surprised. Very light. Not to bitter. Very refreshing. Really good.   So we came to Bosco's on a Friday night but pretty early. We beat the crowd. Our server greeted us quickly and brought us water and our own bottle. There were at least three or four different people serving us and making sure everything was okay. Excellent service. Friendly service which followed the homie feeling inside.   I would say I really enjoyed our whole meal at Bosco's. Great food. Fresh food. Really good service with a wonderful ambience. The prices were even reasonable. All I can say is I can't wait to come back. They have speciality pizzas on the board and can't wait to try them plus their desserts. Need I say more.  Enjoy.

IzAXxJeZWAGfW9dPnvvdhA.text: Excellent! My husband and I are visiting from NM and had heard great things about Il Bosco. We were not disappointed! Jered our server was attentive, knowledgeable, and answered all my questions about the menu. My husband got the Lucia pizza with tomato sauce, mushrooms, cheese, and sausage. The mushrooms were small and quartered, which really added to their flavor. I got the Adrianna pizza with tomato sauce, cheese, and chiffonade basil. Both pizza's were delicious and the crust is to die for! We'd never had such wonderful crust on a brick oven pizza. It was crispy and chewy, absolutely perfect! I had the lemon sorbeto for dessert and it was wonderful! We will definitely be back to this wonderful pizza joint.

kRbNZ7BcfI7GircD9z9axQ.text: 4th time at IL Bosco's and it gets better every time.  Sunday night light crowd and open until 8pm.  The fresh dough and custom high heat oven makes a perfect combination for a browned crust.  I must say my favorite pizza pepperoni, sausage and olive.  Appetizer was a Caprese  cheese and tomatoes which just is out of this world. We also had some cooked red peppers to die for.  Service was quick yet a nice dining experience with friends.  Two thumbs up! #bestPizza

9VE9GuTOiHQxb6HEKxP5Hg.text: Sadly Il Bosco is not nearly same since the new ownership have taken over. The fun, neighborhood vibe is gone. Replaced w uninterested staff. Pizza is not even close either. Pizza was way too cheesy and ingredients were not the same. We won't be going back.

ndYRZqtKFxrq-0sQ0b9hRQ.text: This is the best pizza I've had since moving to AZ 6 yrs ago.  The only drawback was that in order to get a whole "traditional style" pizza, you have to order the 18 inch pie. Their gelato is also first quality.  Highly recommended.

TBA_d8EauuruDYzdK9S4Vw.text: Nice cozy atmosphere. Great for a quiet dinner and has very friendly service. Delicious thin crust pizza (rustic)--what I love about this place is that the sauce and cheese ratio is on point (as well as top quality ingredients). We also ordered a burrata with seasonal vegetables (beets are what we got), which was good but not a huge beet fan. For meat lovers, the pizza can be topped with lots of meat choices--and they top with a good amount. Definitely a local staple.

A6DUvwDEoN7DMka0xP7wKg.text: This place was very dear to our hearts. The family loving vibe started with a warm welcome and ended with a deliciously crafted pizza and full belly. It will never feel the same now that it's been outwardly swiped from under the feet of the Forrest family by its new shady owners. Sadly I will not return and will miss everything about this place- it had taste and atmosphere unlike any other. I do not recommend this NEW Restaurant they are claiming under the Il Bosco family name.

8yYkoZOFRhFpkmO1vOqaaw.text: All I can say is the pizza was excellent in every way possible. The owner is very personable and down-to-earth. The price was more than fair and the location was very accessible if initially somewhat difficult to find. I guess the word Bravo applies. Thank you for your hospitality.

G2fReHbD3RyQ-DN7V-JCtw.text: Awesome pizzas, excellent wine choices and super service. It's a relaxed and fun place!

oOLLcy4bXRCfN2ni3J_j3A.text: Joined friends for dinner at IL BOSCO last night.  Pizza is REALLY good and the appetizers are fantastic. Great vibe and the place will only get better under the new ownership.  There must have been close to 60 pizzas ordered for takeout while we were eating dinner which speaks to the growing popularity.

AlbDQN1cMHiLFsE_Ye75gg.text: Found this place randomly, amazing pizza! Had the meatball appetizers which were great too! Will be making this a regular spot!

CUKmWibk41gLKen24uj6hg.text: This delightfully charming pizzeria has impeccable food and superb service. I live in Los Angeles but make a point to come here each time I'm in town. There's a darling patio with heaters in the cool months; the indoor dining space is rather small, but it's part of the charm.   If you're not making reservations (only taken for parties of 6 or more) you might have a little wait, but not to fear - you can have an Italian beer or nice glass of wine at the bar, and you'll probably make friends with the regulars sitting to your left...and right. This place is popular, and for good reason. The quality is unparalleled, and yet the owner is as humble as can be. Tonight I watched a Postmates guy wait for the pizzas he was delivering. The staff made him at home with some ice water and a dish of their signature olives; how very charming, I thought.

iRR8OYvK_Nch1awVLhN9Xw.text: Had a crowd in town and decided to try the pizza here because we loved the menu!  It was fantastic!  7 pizzas later, we were in heaven!  Great quality!  Can't wait to return!

WWe_n0cpliIbHvTU7JQTrQ.text: This is the best pizza I have had in the PHX area and yes I have had the pizza voted "best". Il Bosco has a great atmosphere the ingredients are high quality and the pizza was baked to absolute perfection. I declare Il Bosco the new king of pizzas!

AYXyvdcK24O_OljhPvhhnQ.text: Superb service, food ! Eat local!!! Casual, indoor/outdoor seating,  Restaurant full of great decor,  character, very cozy, friendly, warm, what more can I say!!!

o0t72xZCchRGK7LocKhfpA.text: Love this place!  Intimate, personalized and attentive service, fantastic food, and a great short wine list. This place doesn't try to be everything to everyone....it EXCELS at what it does!  Don't mis the salsa di parmeseano....that stuff is crack (it sells out early on weekend nights)

EhPXCHGBco9dC5vbl2AWxA.text: Forgot my to go order. Had to awkwardly sitting there for 15 minutes. No explanation and no apologies.

U3nrCqkiFdKuuLF6yx4TLg.text: First time to Il Bosco and I was not disappointed. We shared a Calabrese salad and the pizza special. It was a perfect amount of food for two and delicious. The timing of delivering the pizza to our table was great as was the consistency - no soggy middle like you get other places. The proprietor was friendly and helped us make good choices. The spot is cozy and their brick oven catering looks phenomenal.

O0bDB5WlMEM9-0lezFJ7RQ.text: Il bosco reminded me of a pizza place on lago lugano in switzerland.  The owner is very laid back and generous; he even bought me a "campari" soda.  It's obvious he has a lot of passion in his restaurant.  The ambiance is intimate and the staff is attentive and on their game.  The flavor from the wood fire oven was as expected.  The pizza dough was over kneaded...also, if the portion of bread/crust was less I think I would have been more pleased.  The ingredients seemed fresh but average quality.  The amount of cheese and sauce was perfect though...  I'm honestly unsure if I'll return.  My expectations were higher.  Still, give it a try if you want a decent pizza with great service and atmosphere!

J-2QYlRJuThFQQp8bLzqZw.text: We love wood fired pizza restaurants and this one was quaint.  The owner and staff were great. We were asking the owner a ton of questions about the place, food, etc and he was very generous with his time. The pizzas were really good, sausage good, cheese was yummy. The bread, also made from the pizza dough was nice and crusty with a chewy center. The caprese salad was grape tomatoes with fresh mozzarella and a nice surprise, burrata. Very fresh and good.  He grows his own herbs too.  This is a must try!

n3kCyYMLe44xbmXenRGFWA.text: This place is a hidden gem. Tucked back in an awkward shopping center, I would have never expected this greatness. Il Bosco offers one of the three best pizzas I have ever tried. The atmosphere and ambience of the restaurant was great and I hope I am in the area again so I can get another taste of greatness.

photos.caption: Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

MGPJ1fqW0H2MWcqK1xERwg.text: LOVED the pizza! Little neighborhood place with great, casual atmosphere. A few cozy tables inside and decent size patio outside. We are TOUGH pizza critics and this place is now on the top of the list. Going back for 2nd time in a week. Female server was very easy going and pleasant. Whole thing was totally relaxed and delicious. Owner present and engaged.  Will up this rating to a 5 if it's as great again...... AND if no one takes the offensive-smelling garbage out during our meal and stinks up the whole place. It's a good thing we were finished eating, because if we hadn't been, we would have had to abandon the meal. Poor staff judgement to do that. Poor management judgement to leave the trash long enough to smell that bad and to not clean the bin.

5sIPQUFQe6VL4cRH5P6MhA.text: This place is great! I went there with my mom and my sister. We figured we would order two pizzas and take the rest home as leftovers. Well, the pizzas came and we ate every last bite! So much for those leftovers!   After dinner we had the brownie sundae, which was also to die for. We loved this quaint restaurant and their friendly staff. The owner is so welcoming and pleasant. Thanks for the amazing meal!

QZVfJDK2B9Hdi0JwYfVY3A.text: Came here late night after a day of hiking and exploring. First of all, I would have given this place 4 stars because the food did not live up to the rating based off yelp. I came here with high expectations, and I was with my family. The kids wanted ice cream, the waiter recommended us a lemon sorbet but did not state the price, and since the menu lists a sorbet a certain price we thought it would be the same price we would be charged. Turns out, they were very misleading (minus one star) and we were charged almost 2x as much..I believe it was $7 for half a lemon sized sorbet! Outrageous, esp when we got three of them! Total of three of the sorbets cost the same as one pizza. Pizza is overpriced also, esp since their toppings aren't that much. Disappointed as they did not meet the expectations as I thought they would based on the yelp review.

KRbJS_yLTZZLXB6al1kG0Q.text: Found this place on yelp and was amazed by all the five star reviews. Finally went in last week with the wife and sat at the bar.   Food was great. We had the two pizzas. One was the fig and arugula and one was red sauce with pancetta. Both were great. I'm picky about pizza crust and this place nails it.  The owner seemed super nice added to a great experience. Looking forward to going back to try other pizzas!

6jkSvSw1Rvtme4t_ZwZQZg.text: This is the best pizza in Phoenix, no contest.  I've eaten at pizzeria Bianco many times and I will be moving my business to Il Bosco. You can read my review on Grimaldi's and how i stated it was missing something,  well Il Bosco has the "it" factor.  My wife and I dined here tonight and it was just a great, refreshing experience.  The place is on the smaller side, we sat outside which was great.  The menu is very limited but everything on it looked fantastic.  We opted for the Biaggia which consisted of prosciutto, arugula, a fig sauce, a squeeze of citrus, parmesan shavings and goat cheese. The other pizza we split was the special Zita. This was a white pizza with meatballs and carmelized onions.  Both pizzas were phenomenal.  The flour they use is organic so the pizzas are super light and do not sit heavy at all.  The service is also fantastic as both our waiter and the owner checked on us multiple times and were very informative.  Also, the pizzas came out extremely fast, like less than 5 minutes fast. I can't rave about this place enough, it's worth going out of your way for. .

photos.caption: Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Biaggia Pizza,  prosciutto, arugula, parmesan, fig and citrus. Amazing.
Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Zita Pizza, meatballs and carmelized onion
Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Nice, quaint and tucked away!

ziuiBLD-C3cj2HcSXcJBmw.text: Food was great but what happened?! Service started off amazing then plummeted. No matter how the food is, it's not worth being treated like that. Will never be going back.

a6aiCzm_TN4RbAcp-VDMZw.text: I don't get it. Maybe we just happened to go on a bad day, but there were 5 of us, and the food experience was severely lacking for each of us.   We all ordered different pizzas - each one was very, very salty. Uncomfortably over salted (and I like salty foods).   Spumoni was just taken out of the freezer and served to us. Tasted just like ice cream you'll get from the grocery store - in fact grocery store ice cream is better.   We all had a serving of mediocre food, followed by more of the same in the desert department. Oh, and it was all topped of with a healthy dose of service reeking of attitude.  Maybe our experience was an anomaly, but it was bad enough to dissuade us from any future visits.

vtNe4p3zDvosHVo9U6bqLg.text: I love this place. Starting with the ambiance, which is small, dark, cozy, and Italian, I was impressed. We came on a cool rainy night and sat at the bar, right in front of the wood-fired oven, and the owner made friendly conversation with us the whole time.  We split the Biaggia (prosciutto, goat cheese, fig spread, EVOO) and the Dona (mozzarella, pancetta, roma tomatoes, parmesan, and tomato sauce). The crust was perfectly chewy and had a slightly sweet flavor, which I love. The toppings were fresh and high-quality. I just wish we had more room, because we also really wanted to order the egg and pancetta pizza. Next time... and there will be a next time!!!

RnMBBzGQhuUEIyY-IY7-Mg.text: If this place becomes too big of a deal and I have to start waiting a long time I'm going to...well, I'm going to not be happy.  Tiny ceramic olive dishes! Calligraphy'd menus! A pizza oven that's RIGHT THERE! Dim lighting, a cute little (emphasis on "little") patio, perfect service and THE PIZZA. GAH.  Never mind. I was going to elaborate on the pesto-ridiculousness I've experienced both times we came here, but I don't want to share. Forget you read this. Carry on.

DsfK7Q8oyxDsUo9YDDsoSA.text: We were starving and wandering around Scottsdale Quarter, so we decided to pop into True Food to eat. In spite of there being lots of open tables, they said there would be an epic wait - or we could sit with some strangers or on a sofa outside. I didn't feel like doing either of those things, so we split and headed south. I used yelp to find the best place that was still open and on the way.   Il Bosco showed up with the best overall score, and neither of us had eaten here so we decided to give it a shot. It's tucked away in a little nook next to Handlebar J's and looked cute and inviting. We wandered in and were seated right away. It's a cozy little place - clearly decorated with care and love.  We both ordered water (sparkling and still) and they came in these fancy artisan bottles that were left at our table along with a pair of small glasses filled with ice. I like when restaurants do this. They also brought out a tiny strange plate with olives on it. Neither of us eat olives, so we sorta poked at them, puzzled over them and dared each other to eat one.   The menu was elegant and beautiful - simple and hand written. We later got an explanation from the owner that he had a local artist make them by hand. Details details... this place is rich in details. The items on the menu were pretty much just salads and pizzas.   Everything about this place says "fancy fine-dining" and if I hadn't looked at the prices I would've thought it was going to be too rich for my blood. As it turns out, the prices were VERY reasonable. The only thing I thought was a little pricey was the water - on any other night I would've ordered wine though, and the wine prices were appropriate.   We ordered a pizza (half and half - something you can do as long as the sauces match) and a caesar salad. They brought some artisan bread with herb oil for us to snack on, and we made that disappear. The salad was split into two plates and we quickly ate that up as well - it wasn't drowning in dressing. It was an excellent presentation and a good salad.   The pizza then arrived... it was about a 10-12" woodfired pizza. My half was pepperoni and sausage. Her half was just cheese. Each half had a name on the menu - girls names if I remember correctly. We each took a piece over to our plates and started digging in. Right off the bat, I noticed how rich and creamy the cheese was. The pepperoni was light and had a perfect amount of spice behind it. The sauce was flavorful. The most notable part was the crust though - light, crisp, airy, and delicate.   We both cleaned our plates - the only things we left behind were the olives. We also ordered a dessert - creme brule - it was one of the best I've ever had. We were both full, but we didn't feel like we needed to be wheeled out to the car in a cart. It was the perfect amount of food. It was also pretty inexpensive for what you get. This is high quality fine dining with great atmosphere and attentive staff. This is a new date-night spot for me. It's also inexpensive enough to make it a regular spot.  Had a chat with the owner who was waiting on us most of the night, and he seems like a great guy. We could tell that he loved his business. I like supporting local businesses, and this 5 star review is one of the most deserved that I've ever given.

YZDFOqv7IAOhoSwfCf-9Jg.text: I'd heard about Il Bosco from Yelp, was in the area, and thought I would try some of their pizza.  It is very small, with a small outside seating area.  The menu has pizza, salads, two appetizers, and two desserts.  They have a wood fired pizza oven, which gives their pizza the perfect crust. They do have beer and wine, although a limited selection.  I ordered the Joanna Pizza - pepperoni, sausage, cheese and tomatoes, and had them add onions. It was delicious, one of the best pizza's I have tasted.  I was going to give it a four star rating, but had several pieces left over, which I took home for breakfast the next day.  Wow!! It is the only pizza I have had that actually tasted better the day after!! That in and of itself, bumps them up to a five star rating.  Another plus is their prices are very, very reasonable.  All in all, a great little restaurant.

D05koRSJbP_IPpHDM3vNPw.text: This place was a little tricky for us to find, but we weren't disappointed! Great food and awesome customer service! Make sure you get the fried raviolis, they were amazing!!!!

Z3M4FPrbtXHXet3nUrD9NQ.text: I think I may have discovered pizza nirvana.   I am a firm believer that a restaurant should pick something- and do it well. Il Bosco embodies this philosophy completely. The place is small and cozy, with a warm, rustic environment. The menu is simple with very few options- which I appreciate. It's even written by hand by an Italian calligrapher (then copied, but still!)   We were immediately served a small plate of olives upon being seated. I hate olives, but I appreciated the sentiment! I even worked up the nerve to try one, but it just confirmed that I do, in fact, still hate olives. The homemade bread and seasoned olive oil that followed was fantastic though.  My beverage of choice was sparkling water, which even that is made in house! It was served in a pretty glass bottle, tastefully etched with their logo. It was a little spendy at $4, but it was nice to have the bottle at the table to refill my cup as needed. The drink really was the only thing that was a little high priced, the pizza and appetizers were VERY reasonable- low even.  I opted for a plain cheese pizza with red sauce and basil. I had sort of high expectations after seeing that this place only had 5 star reviews, but even still I wasn't disappointed. I've had wood fired pizza at a number of places in Arizona, and this one really stands out to me. I think I could safely say that this is my favorite pizza in the valley. The crust is perfect. Not too fluffy, not too thin. Crispy parts, with doughy bubbles that are chewy in the center. The sauce was the perfect balance of savory and sweet, and I could taste a hint of red wine. The cheese was out of this world. I actually meant to ask the owner (who was waiting on us) about what made the cheese so fantastic. I will next time for sure.   They knew my dessert weakness, and had creme brulee with berries on the menu. I couldn't resist. I went against the owner's recommendation of the Lemon dessert, and I'm glad I did. The creme brulee was amazing, and each berry on top was ripe and sweet.  Seriously, I have no complaints about this place. It was a great date night dinner and I enjoyed my experience from start to finish. I can't wait to go back!

Ndi6JMY6tg6Di-B3m4Dd5A.text: Eager staff, like they are on a mission to serve.  Quiet and cozy place.  Not what you want for a first date if you need a little energy from the enviro.  Well-crafted za, and baked by a guy watching the flecks of dough cook to perfection.  Their idea of perfection looks a little dark, so you should like a slight charring.  The prosciutto ingredient is the real thing.  The crust is lean.  It seems like flour, water, yeast, salt - no or little shortening.  This is not the golden pie where your hand comes away greasy after grabbing a slice.  Excellent salad - fresh romaine, good sharp cheese.  If you don't like a healthy dose of dressing ask for them to lighten up, but the caesar - it's tasty!  Interesting selection of italian wines at $8-10 for a small-med pour.  This is an artisan's pizza and deserves a try to round out the rich, cheesy pies that are found elsewhere.

unvILCw51CPMCBdYth7BJw.text: My husband and I ordered the Joanna and the Donna for dinner tonight.  Because we had such a great pizza a few weeks ago we wanted to try it again. BIG MISTAKE.  We each had one slice and threw the rest  out.  Didn't taste like pizza and the  crust was not done at all.  One of the pizzas was so bad we were afraid to eat anymore of it, nothing tasted right, didn't even smell right.  When we called to complain and let them know about the pizzas we were met with " well we haven't had any complaints tonight and I'm sure when you come back in you will find it better". No offer of free pizza and no apology.  Never going back, too bad, we like supporting local small business.

w1rzUegoqachbRpD7rejBw.text: Il Bosco is a hidden gem with authentic "real" Italian pizza like the pizza you get while in Italy. Everything is made from fresh organic ingredients and "il capo cuoco" just doesn't cut corners. Everything is delivered with pride and care - fresh olives, thick-crust fresh bread and olive oil to start and the water and ice tea are served extra chilled. Love this place and we often find our regular table to enjoy the best pizza in Scottsdale.

uAR8PhjgDsozUinZperSTw.text: Needed to find a new lunch place in Scottsdale so I searched YELP..found this one and we tried it..   Very charming little spot. We ate outside and that was absolutely pleasant! Asked what to have and we were recommended to have the Biaggia. (Fig, prosciutto, arugula oh my..!) it was perfectly devine.   Prices were perfect for the individual sized wood fired pizza. Def going to go again! We have been looking for a good wood fired pizza with similarities to the el Vicino Pizzas(CO) styles. yaaaa :)

4jRUz4GeopMhM_97BTGdUw.text: In the area and felt like pizza.  This place had a good rating so we tried it.  Had the kale and spinach salad.  It was good, not a big fan of kale.  Also had the fried ravioli which was ok.  It was on special so wet tried it.   My wife and I both had a pizza.  We should have shared one as they were bigger than we thought.    We actually had a whole pie to take home.   The service was great, they keep on top of where we were with our meal and timed the pizza to arrive when we finished the ravioli and salad.   I definitely recommend this place.

ZtseCtQnG7KSx71m6bsIVw.text: I have now eaten here several times and the service as well as the food has been top notch. I only wish they had a slightly more diverse menu, but that is not a deal killer for us. We love their pizza and my wife enjoys several of the other dishes. I nice find in Scottsdale that I highly recommend for anyone looking to dine in a nice comfy Italian bistro style restaurant. Great job guys!!!

2nJsMW2sqJZPgSbBEn4fiQ.text: Caprese Salad, Lucia and Adrianna were absolutely delicious!!! We will definitely be back!

lBWFmxyOrlvejQ6XK8sl7Q.text: Second week in a row I ate here. As close to perfection as you can get. From the Caesar salad to the pizza to the creme brulee and espresso it was wonderful.  I am a new regular. Thank you

VQ2YGIWsxXw1DMKJP0gImg.text: Great hidden gem. Delicious wood oven cooked pizzas. Nice, small lunch menu and very fair prices, about $7-$8 for a lunch sized 8 inch pizza.   To add to experience, the owner and staff are incredibly friendly and welcoming.   Well worth a visit.

kMo7zxbeN2u7fpEI5Y-QiQ.text: Mouthwatering cuisine really can come in a small package and Il Bosco is here to prove that size definitely does not matter! I met the lovely Anna M for lunch recently and much to my delight, she introduced me to Il Bosco.   Hidden down an alley on the north west corner of Shea and Scottsdale Road, Il Bosco is a humble abode filled with a whole lot of flavor. The restaurant itself is tiny and probably only hold around 50-60 people. Upon walking in, I was immediately greeted by the scent of pizza baking in the wood fired oven and a feeling of hominess with dark wood and brick paneling and close seating. You know those restaurants where they offer you an "eating in the kitchen" experience and make you make a reservation months in advance for the chance to "dine with the chef" Well here, you get to do so every time you visit because the open kitchen is just steps away from the seating. Therefore you get to see the pizza being created from scratch and here's the best part of the entire experience...the pizza cooks in 90 seconds! Yes 90 seconds!   I ordered the Biaggia which comes with prosciutto, figs, four cheeses, arugala and evo. The lunch pizzas are personal pizzas so Anna ordered the Lucia which comes with cheese, tomato sauce, sausage and mushrooms. I could smell the pizza being made and I started to drool with anticipation. Finally a whole 90 seconds later, poof! The pizza appeared and I took my first heavenly bite which turned into many more heavenly bites. This pizza is some of the best pizza I've ever had and I have had my fair share of pizza! The crust is a combination of crunchy and chewy and it's seasoned to perfection. The toppings are a perfect combination of sweet and savory and compliment the crust perfectly. I must say that the Biaggia was by far the most superb pizza I've had in quite some time. The Lucia was also extremely good but the Biaggia stole poor Lucia's thunder. It was a delicious lunch and I really enjoyed the atmosphere. It's one of the best kept secrets around but I don't think it should be a secret. Everyone should experience this pizza!   I will leave you with one more little fun fact. They have a portable wood fired oven that they use for catering! It's amazing and would be great for a party. I also noticed that they have a walk-up window where you can order take-out.

cj13R8rDoBaNi667ywmGtw.text: Friendly staff. Cozy restaurant with a wonderful patio. Started with olives and bread (free) and then ordered the Caprese Salad, which was wonderful and our delicious wood fired sausage pizza! Definitely will return.

cr1WXS7qwCUPkWe3oJiHKA.text: We were just talking about the best pizza we've ever had and my wife and son realized they had both been here on separate occasions. Both emphatically agree it was the best pizza they have ever had ... and our family appreciates great pizza - very discerning

5cQ7OxwNVROlCS89s4Hd0A.text: Really good pizza try the Carmela and lucia. Don't forget to order the cesar salad best ever. Not the classic pizza something really good made wood fire

Yx8T0yaC0Vhy0ZQjrW_18A.text: I went into Il Bosco for lunch and found that my party was the only group in the restaurant (okay, we were getting lunch at like 3 pm, which I guess is weird). This actually turned into a charming experience. We talked to the owner for a while and he told us the story of how he got his start.   He served us himself, and the food was fantastic! Super fresh, and we got to watch them make our pizza in the brick oven! We ordered the Biaggia pizza off the lunch menu, and it was topped with figs, prosciutto, cheese and arugula. Totally excellent combo! The Bistecca sandwich, with steak and mushrooms, was also good. Menu items were simple but fresh and clearly from high quality ingredients. I loved talking to the owner as well, it seems like this whole place was made with love!

HW6KV7javRDq-iU5uc6mxA.text: Our favorite pizza place in town! We took local friends for their 1st time and they loved it! It was packed when we arrived at 7:30 but Barbara and Bill welcomed us with hugs and wine - we were seated within 10 min at a great table on the cozy patio- under strung party lights and outdoor heating - resting on pillows at our seats I told Bill the atmosphere is like heaven. We shared the kale and spinach and caprese salads before sampling a few of the specials pizza and my favorite, the Biaggia. We're all coming back, especially to see Arturo, the mystery guest- chances are he'll be there for your next visit too.

rmJdtTDtkL6mbgY6cNdRUg.text: I wandered in here last week, late on a Friday evening, and found the place almost deserted.  Bill greeted me at the door, I asked if I could have a meal, and he sat me down at the bar.  Almost immediately I was impressed by the hospitality.  I looked at the menu, which is just a sheet of paper with drinks on one side, and pizzas, salads, desserts, and antipasti on the other, and found it promising.  Why?  Not because it was extensive, but rather because it was limited.  I like a place that just does a couple of things, and does those things well.  Each day there is a different pizza of the day, salad of the day, and I think antipasti of the day.  My first visit, I went with a split pizza--half Maria (pesto, garlic, and tomato) and half Biaggia (prosciutto, goat cheese, fig, maybe something else)--along with a Boylan's root beer.  The root beer turned out to actually be a Boylan's Creamy Red Birch Beer (Bill said he promises his customers this is the best root beer they'll ever have.  It's partially True, in that it's better than many root beers, but it's technically not a root beer. Get it anyways.), which was actually a nice surprise. (Boylan's Birch Beer would be even better...)  I liked the Maria, but I LOVED the Biaggia.  This was a very good pie, and based on the other reviews here, it possibly could be considered their signature pie.  On my second visit, a week later, I had the Dona, a red pizza with tomatoes and pancetta.  The pancetta was nice and crispy, and of course, delicious.  They also serve you olives while you wait; these were some of the best olives I've had.  I couldn't stop eating them.  They actually tasted fresh (well...as fresh as an olive can get, considering you have to basically wipe out their original bitter flavor when you cure them).  The best part about this restaurant is that it has the feel of a small neighborhood restaurant.  It gets busy during the dinner rush, but if you come a little later, it'll be more relaxed, and you can actually strike up a conversation with the staff.  Good pie, excellent establishment.

dtQvyNgfKpeiaNEfVNFFJA.text: I loved everything about Il Bosco from the food to the atmosphere but did not appreciate it when the man serving us rolled his eyes at me when I asked to sample a wine. Now had this been a server who hated his job, I could've shrugged it off but this man was the OWNER. Then after I enjoyed it enough to order a glass, he forgot to bring it to me (we were one of two tables on a Tuesday night). This is why I'm giving three stars instead of four, possibly five. You can't skip out excellent service just because you have excellent food (which Il Bosco truly does) and the owner of the establishment should know this and provide this and if he can't, he should hire someone who can.

ZraPMH00zqDcXO1k_5Kelw.text: We were introduced to Il Bosco by a very close friend who is a chef. Looking through their Yelp reviews and website I saw that they also cater! Our first dinner was fabulous and I knew I wanted them to cater my upcoming wedding. Their pizza is delicious, ambiance is great, and staff are so friendly. Bill made the process so easy and their catering prices are fantastic. My guests LOVED pizza at the wedding. Who wouldn't like fresh pizza at a wedding?! With the pizza oven parked in my driveway, they did passed appetizers, salad, pizza, and cannoli for desert. This was the best decision I made for my wedding. Out with cold catered chicken piccata and in with IL BOSCO!!!

409RgGvSMvVQjMaR20GHjA.text: I've been waiting too long to write reviews, so all I can tell you is that the food is quite good. It's four stars. If you want the best, go to Pomo in Phoenix, Piazza al Forno in Glendale, and maybe Bianco.  The owner didn't think I was legit when I walked in. I came in for a late lunch, as usual, well after 1:00. It was quiet, might have had the whole place to myself. When I walked in, the owner did some kind of read on me and pegged me as someone who might be looking for a random pizza place, might not appreciate the kind of primo place this was. Picture a Mexican dude walking in in khaki shorts, polo shirt, nice sandals. Call it a graduate student uniform, or an Arizona uniform, but maybe it's a big departure from the normal North Scottsdale lunch crowd.  Anyway, I sensed the vibe come from him -- he thought I didn't know what kind of place this was. So we were talking, and I mentioned that I'd been to Bianco and Humble Pie, that I took Alan Richman's Top 25 pizza places in America and used it as a guide for my trip through the northeast (try Bob and Timmy's in Providence, RI -- they grill their pizza, man). From this, it seemed like he understood that I was a serious individual, someone who was there for the real thing.

8UMrSp5uxEfw0ouWlAugCA.text: Since I'm on a never-ending quest for the best pizza with figs on it in the world (life's too short for quests of any actual importance), I had to check out the Biaggia, made with goat cheese, fig, arugula and proscuitto. It put forth a decent effort, but needed more fig and goat cheese. However, the crust was dreamy and the service was friendly, which sort of compensated for a few extra dollops of flavor-balancing pizza toppings. Il Bosco also offers small, tasty desserts, topped with Sweet Republic ice cream. Double local business points for ordering one of those after (get the brownie, warm.)  The bill came out 50 bucks for two pizzas and three desserts, which I'd consider a good deal for ze quality. The crust is truly awesome, the patio's relaxing and pretty, and the free olives are always appreciated. You can pretty much taste the integrity in the pizza at this little local spot, and you probably should if you find yourself in the area.

P10YiXzgw7J0VRUAT-juSQ.text: My favorite local pizza date night.  Definitely prefer over Cibo. Priced fairly and the bread is to die for.

unUsAiB98ITOyREeQCadnw.text: OMG! Pizza heaven. I just had my first pizza here and it has jumped to the top of my list. Similar style to Pomo or Bianco but something about this one....crust was just perfect. Toppings not overly done so you can taste each ingredient. Friendly staff and a nice , cozy setting. Will be back soon!  Joanna , I love you .....

Gm_pwDQiNXS7j1vMin2G1A.text: I love wood fire & brick oven pizza. So, found this tiny (and mean TINY) restaurant  by accident after ditching Jack N the Box. Its tucked behind fast food, big name franchises on the North/East corner of Scottsdale & Shea and is a nice little gem.   Besides how small the place is, the first thing you notice is the menu is very small (dinner menu is a little bigger), so me and my friend picked different things and shared. We got a personal pizza and a meatball sandwich. The sandwich was good, but not spectacular, but the pizza is awesome! I went back again for dinner and again the pizza was terrific, as was the salad; delicious. We asked them to do a half and half and they said no problem which is great; I hate when places won't compromise for make you feel guilty for changing their stuff. I loved it and my girlfriend loved it. Also something fun is their soda is not fountain drinks, but bottled real-sugar cane sodas that are delicious.  The only strange thing I have to say is the owner doubles as the server and he is very chatty. That's not a bad thing; he is a very nice guy but be prepared to have a conversation with the guy.  Recommend for a casual lunch and dinner for gourmet pizza & salad.  Pros: Amazing pizza, great food, great service and inviting setting. Cons: Very small menu; caters more toward veggie eaters rather than meaty pizzas.

ZeIevcohh1SvKc9ArhG3aw.text: I made a reservation for 8 on the patio on their phone messages where I clearly stated name and phone number and details of my party. After not hearing back, I called back to make sure and spoke to someone who told me they had not checked the messages but assured me my table would be ready for the following evening. When our party arrived at the designated time... no table.  An hour later we were seated!  What good are reservations if no one pays attention? Very frustrating!!!! Liz B.

0QlMGJQkvN5jJ4S6Fhgb4Q.text: We love Il Bosco . Best pizza in scottsdale! Good service, friendly & efficient. We wish the new owner ,Jeff much success. Ann & Tom Will will return.

Ia92TmrWoeDfwtHgM6Gt4w.text: For some reason, Scottsdale is a pizza town.  There are so many independent pizza makers here. Fortunately, IL Bosco stands out magnificently.  The food is consistently good and, although I believe the prices have been raised under the new management, it is still a decent value.  We started going there when the original owner and creator opened it, and we have continued going there each time we allow ourselves a treat.  When we heard of Bill's passing, we really grieved.  This place was truly special, and he treated every customer like good friends.  I think the place is still special, and I appreciate that the people who took it over are trying to keep the place as Bill intended.  I highly recommend IL Bosco and wish the new owners well.  I hope you allow yourselves the freedom to keep reinventing the place.  Bill was always trying new ideas and that is part of the spirit that makes the place a gem in the middle of a sea of sameness.

YPv8ammsKumQ_MurM6q23w.text: I discovered II Bosco while searching on Yelp. WOW...what a great find!  The pizza was incredible, great service and really nice outdoor setting to enjoy the evening.   Finished off the meal with dessert, a delicious chocolate chip cookie a-la-mode and it was really wonderful! I'll be back asap to enjoy more pizza and probably another chocolate chip cookie a-la-mode.  Also worth noting the menu prices were very reasonable for the quality of pizza!

QhC1esNL9YKaSQBsskAYKw.text: I have been coming to IL Bosco for about a year now and can say it is my favorite pizza place in Arizona. From the food to the service, everything about this family operated restaurant is amazing. I have come in about almost ten times already, whether it be with my girlfriend, friends or family, and have always had a great experience. Jarrod by far is the most genuine and humble person you'll meet. Such a caring guy and always provides excellent care and  detail to the table.

f1nByycSVvNXY2oUBVo8Nw.text: WOW!! Absolutely F'in amazing pizza. I'm a neighbor to this spot and never stopped in till today!  This pizza is so damn amazing ,I wanted to call every pizza spot I've tried and ask them what the heck they've been doing this whole time ?!? This is the spot I will bring my lady, friends, family ,enemies, and in-laws to. Don't take my word for it. See for yourself.   Save me a seat!

TRmuIqNeKIYbWbKaQotb9g.text: Great service, great pizza, amazing dessert!   Found Il Bosco on Yelp and I'm so glad that we did! As soon as we got here we were greeted by the owner. Although there was a short wait (5-10 minutes) he found us a spot to sit and got our drinks right away. We ordered the Dona which was delicious. The crust, cheese and sauce were amazing! We finished with splitting the brownie a la mode and considered ordering another because it was that good!   Would absolutely recommend this to anyone in the area! We will definitely be back!

TJoXovcBymrGIFywHwT0Wg.text: Took a chance and popped in on Valentines day without a reservation (don't even know if they take reservations).  Anyway, we got lucky as there were 4 seats available (would have been more seats but the patio was closed due to inclement weather).   Seated immediately and then...no server.  Had to call over to the hostess to get service.  Once we got that settled, service was fine (mostly).  Had the caprese salad and the valentino pizza (no, not just because it was V Day).  Caprese was amazing and I think the balsamic and some hint of pesto maybe are the key...this is not your everyday boring tomato/cheese plate.   The pizza likewise blew my mind. I'm slightly spice averse but the heat from the Calebrien (sp) chiles was perfect.     Wine selection was perfect match for the cuisine.  Overall, just need to work on service. I understand there was a management change recently BUT the food definitely makes up for this (and hopefully service will improve).    PS. why am i typing almost every sentence with parentheticals (why not?)

jdQrI0IOPr64zEZhoPMBJQ.text: What a quaint little hidden dining spot in Scottsdale with amazing food! We had a big group so we got to try many of the pizzas and ALL were delicious... including the wine,bread and olive oil! The atmosphere is suitable for a large group yet feels cozy for an intimate dinner for two! Love this place, GREAT FIND!!!
