KTM-f0SPjo5KvhFOxqRI9w.text: Amazing food!! Delicious pizza, great appetizers and affordable wine. Perfect for a date night! 10/10 recommend!

JAtVDraPn_9trvxpRUP6NQ.text: This is a wonderful quaint pizzeria. All of the pizzas are prepared in a wood fired oven. The Elana pizza is amazing!! Good drinks and good company as well. I will definitely be back!

oUKpuIRP6v-nJ2nXALBUyg.text: This restaurant is so charming and the Pizza is so good!!! My favorite is the one with the figs. The staff are also all very friendly and helpful.

fo8NU2olBzN-5fiNWUGugg.text: Delicious, fresh pizza and great service. Would definitely go back. Lovely night to sit on the patio with the heater going and music coming from the bar next door.

yj5ddtv0huAwLRnUHFz4Qg.text: This restaurant and its new ownership continue the tradition of providing very high quality food at completely reasonable prices.  We have been getting takeout from Il Bosco for years, and the food hasn't skipped a beat.  My family and I get takeout here at least once every 2 weeks and tonight I treated my small company and we dined in.  Their service was excellent, and the food came out quickly and it was all outstanding! Anyone that reviews Il Bosco anything different than 4-5 stars shouldn't be considered as an authority on food.   You won't be disappointed at all.  It will blow away other local pizza joints.  The Pappadelle Peppers, Mia, and Gabriella pizzas are amazing!

u0AygqHXNmnk_59R4Ygbbg.text: We have frequented this place for years and I made a point to meet the new management. We had a fantastic experience. Food was still delicious. Service and new management were awesome. You could tell these are good people who care about their customers! Highly recommend.

QHv6jOBJ94aRAuZTxym2xg.text: This used to be my go to place. The quality of the pizza has gone down hill significantly and the environment is unwelcoming. I used to tell everyone how great this place is, but now I recommend going to pizzeria Bianco or Grimaldi's.

L4aGcwwk8yjlX_vC0wprSQ.text: Absolutely love this spot. They catered our wedding a few years ago and we have a great experience every time we go. The pizza is delicious and cooked perfectly in their wood fire oven. Highly recommend the Bella.

sl13RdNU9pbHv_Zk4fkAkw.text: Il Bosco has nearly 300 awesome reviews for a reason.   The pizza is tremendous in every way. Everything is homemade and you can tell from the vivid flavors.   Mr. Forrest and his family operate this gem and are nothing short of wonderful. Having a meal here is like going to a good friend's home for a relaxing, perfect meal. The ambiance is warm and cozy, the music is on point- the service is spot on, and again- the food is epic.     It's worth noting that they also do a great job with takeout. Simply place your phone order ahead of time- and when you arrive they will fire your pie- and two minutes later you're out the door.  One other thing I must highlight is the bread you get with dinner. If you are a bread aficionado- you will flip out when you try their house made bread. It's incredible and they would be a successful bakery if all they did was sell that bread.   The location is great and they also have a lovely patio for dining when the weather doesn't feel like the surface of the sun.   Give this wonderful spot a try. I have tried all the "best" in AZ and I unequivocally rate Il Bosco #1.  Try it and you will too.   *Bonus pro tip- if you have leftover pizza, for the love of God don't reheat it in your microwave. Either reheat in the oven or fire up your BBQ for a quick warm up. You'll thank me.

photos.caption: Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The whole crew is warm, professional, and all around awesome.
Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mr. Forrest &amp; his work of art. You&#39;ll be hard pressed to find a nicer and more dedicated business owner.

AazRQqLXOQA2_j_VlCflyw.text: IL Bosco used to be my favorite spot in town, the OG owner Bill and his Sons made this a truly unique family owned restaurant. I went in recently and was saddened to find the family had been pushed out by new ownership. I still ate there and noticed the food was not as fresh as usual and many ingredients were missing off my favorite pizza and appetizers. I will never go back to IL Bosco Pizza after learning how the new owners took advantage of previous arrangements after the founder Bill suddenly passed away. The new owners should be ashamed for forcing out Bills sons right after the passing of their father. Where are your morals?! This is simply bad business and karma will catch up.

OX4s5oY5pU6-hZkfdvX-SQ.text: Amazing staff and authentic fire wood pizza. Fantastic outdoor patio. Catering is available. It has a cool vibe and relaxing atmosphere. It's next to Handle Bar J and is somewhat hidden. There's a good wine selection and awesome appetizers.

photos.caption: Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

SVFlbzaGWmQisBebMXy4hw.text: Wow, this place is so cute and on top of that, it is delicious.  My hubby told me about this place almost a year ago and he was raving about the pizza.  Then, I have seen all the check- ins from Anna M., so I kept trying to make time to come and check it out myself.  I wish I had come sooner, although my hips and thighs might not appreciate that.  We ordered the Biaggia pizza.  I learned it is the most popular, I chose it mainly because I saw figs and prosciutto on it, two of my favorite ingredients.  Then we noticed the next table having a salad I didn't see on the menu.  Well, duh, it was in the specials.  They have daily specials on boards above the bar area.  We decided to share the spinach and kale caesar.  It was so fresh and tasty.  Then on the other table, I saw a dessert that was not on the menu either.  The owner told us it was an apple pizza, part of the special menu also.  Yes, I love to check out what everyone else is eating.  Our dessert was warm and amazing, and the scoop of vanilla  ice cream completed this perfect meal.  We were offered a taste of their homemade Amaretto.  What a treat, it was delicious.  This place made me very reminiscent of my daddy, we used to cook all our italian dishes on Sundays and my daddy used to make his own Lemoncello.  I definitely will come back and I won't wait almost a year to make it.

nsXAnIevsnvbEB05KMxq7A.text: I found this place a couple of months ago and it is hands down the best pizza in Arizona. I come from the East Coast where pizza was invented, and Il Bosco Pizza rivals the best pizza restaurants there including Pepe's. Service is always great and the pricing is very fair. Bill the owner is super friendly and cares about what he does. There is magic in the pie because of the blend of cheese, sauce and dough. If you are looking for the best pizza in Arizona, you better try this place so you can compare the rest to the best!

mc0sOb7pQXGDqDAw8mtKUQ.text: A hidden gem in Scottsdale. The pizza compares favorably with the best in Arizona (Pizzeria Bianco), the patio is lovely and the service is great. Run, don't walk to Il Bosco!

YwL_e4KPyQCYEtv5Q19rfQ.text: Lovely, quaint place away from the usual Scottsdale & Shea crowd.  Great pizza, amazing service and attention to detail.  The proprietor is warm, friendly and knows his italian food.

aRQTqPBAbUScBTeqJZ8BYA.text: After reading reviews on Yelp, we left a different pizza place to come here.  I'm glad we did.  The pizza was fantastic; I could have stayed there and watched them make pizza for hours.  The wood fire oven is right there and watching them work is inspiring.  The owner, Bill Forrest, was there and took our order.  It was so nice to see an owner go and visit with the patrons, calling most of them by name, to make sure people were happy with their experience.   Bill cares...about the food they make and about the people who visit.  What a great combination.  I love to eat quality food.  I don't exercise like a should, so I do my best to have a healthy diet because I still have an active lifestyle.  I have become passionate about food, usually preferring to make/grow my own food.    Some day, when I get "20 seconds of crazy insane courage," I will follow Bill's example and do things the right way...the way he does it at Il Bosco Pizza.

nqu9xaVIzcjxIhbyMbmtRQ.text: Pizzas are amazing but much of everything else on the menu is not all that great.  Example:  my salad consisted of wilted, slimy, and old lettuce.  The replacement dish that the waiter brought to me was no better.  However, the waiter took the salad off the bill so at least the customer service is up to par.  Again, pizzas are unique and delicious.  I would go back for the pizza.

QKpSKQKo6DMt9ooqKLa2Nw.text: This is great small italian restaurant. It's very small but has a nice feel to it. The food is excellent.

7qL9bEd6ICyZb2nH_TxiHg.text: AMAZING. Best pizza place west of the Mississippi hands down. Perfect dough, and sauce. Quality that other places lack.

bnOIzKfqhb11y3djlhDQMg.text: What a wonderful experience. One of my regulars keyed me into this place and I was beyond impressed.  Friday night during prime dinner hours and we were lucky enough to get a table inside. They have lots of seating outside which would be perfect come warmer weather. For now they have heat lamps.  Service was impeccable. The owner floats around and helps his staff and enhances the dining experience (completely unlike the other review mentioned). We were brought a carafe of water, olives and bread to start. We ordered the caprese salad to start. I would eat this EVERY DAY. They use a pesto balsamic glaze that is to die for. The mozzarella is fresh and the cherry tomatoes were bursting with flavor. Next we had one of their specials, fried ravioli. Simple and tasty. Portions here are well sized without going overboard like the chain Italian restaurants do. To finish we ordered the Becca pizza, another special. The crust is delicious here and not one you would want to leave uneaten on the side of your plate.  I can't stress how fresh and wonderfully prepared everything was. I personally cannot wait to go back (did I mention how amazing the caprese salad was?!). This restaurant earns the five star rating because our experience was flawless and anyone who experienced otherwise must be mistaken.

ZxN3YgWQlrScUhZ8zPPCsA.text: This is my favorite pizza place in the valley. The fig, prosciutto, goat cheese & arugula pizza is out of this world! The owner operator is super friendly. Last time he sent us home with a loaf of fresh baked bread!

qlOcQ_BezYme9cw9MGFTvg.text: We were on a mission, not one of pizza in general, we just didn't want to go home. So we roamed the streets of the North/Central Valley.  It started with a late breakfast with drinks which kept taking us North and then East, eventually arriving at Il Bosco.   We were the only patrons in there at the time the staff was hustling and bustling.  Come to find out they had a large catering event that evening (love their portable wood fired pizza oven)  and they had also started the preparation of a Superbowl party they were catering on Sunday.    Even with all the Prep going on  Bill greeted us upon entering.  My accomplice (Anna M) had been telling me about this place and we finally stopped in.  Each of us decided on the house Pino Grigio and we decided to split the Biaggia.  I came to this decision with some reluctance, I love fresh figs and find that dried figs can be overly dry and strange when sliced on a pizza or bruschetta  and when it is more of a jam it is often too sweet or applied in a quantity that overwhelms the palate.  Appropriate in their place but often not done well figs can be hit or miss.   I was reassured by both Bill and Anna that all would be ok.     It wasn't long before the pizza was before us.  This was the perfect personal sized lunch pizza (just smaller than the pizza's at Bianco's) . Fresh arugula,  Prosciutto, 4 cheese, evoo  and fig; each cheese was identifiable but none was over powering.  The salinity  of the cheeses and prosciutto really lent themselves amazingly to the lightly sweet caramel earthiness that was the fig component of the pizza.  A perfectly measured drizzle of fig puree, intermingled with extra virgin olive oil and the green peppery nature of arugula... I was sold on the Biaggia.  But what really made me think perfection was the crust.  Having just eaten at Bianco's earlier in the week the essence of their crust was still fresh in my mind as I compared  flavors and textures.  Il Bosco totally wins, tender chewy and crispy, light and slightly sweet not overly toasty or "burnt".  The bottom of the crust was cooked at a heat high enough to give the pizza a sturdy base without altering the tenderness of the crust.    Just when I thought it couldn't get any better I was introduced to the house cured olives.  These were heavenly, ripe, flavorful, gently cured and far from the salty, brine-y  commercially available olives commonly offered up at other establishments.   I noticed they sell them by the jar and I regret not picking up a jar before I left, as I find myself  daydreaming about these rich dusky pearls.   Oh well it is not like I needed an excuse to go back but this will give me a reason to go back sooner than expected.

Ojym75sp65V5r1cz4B1j4w.text: We genuinely enjoyed our evening at Il Bosco, a tucked-away restaurant just off Shea and Scottsdale. The owner and staff were super friendly, the ambiance was what a good neighborhood restaurant should be (though so many aren't) and, of course, the food was great! We began with an appetizer plate of roasted brussel sprouts with mozzarella, an unexpected combination that really works! We then had the Joanna pizza, a fantastic, wood-oven, thin-crust sausage and pepperoni that had great flavor and crust. For dessert, the days special was a lemon sorbetto, packed into a real lemon, a perfect ending. I should also mention the great music selection which added quite a bit to the flavor of the evening. I'm already looking forward to the next visit!

hrXBVD-fhC62aMm7JBcp0Q.text: The pizza may be good; however, we didn't get that far!  Atmosphere might be like eating in a morgue - owner is rude and a terrible host!  We walked out and will NEVER return.  On to POMO - OUR FAVORITE!

Cmy1duVjovEHQKCeUtUsQA.text: Unexpectedly great.  Ate outside and listened to live country music from the bar next door.  Fantastic food, friendly service.

Ws3Nktgn-V1k4qba7iHO4Q.text: Great fun pizzas. Good wine. Would give 5 stars if service was better to ask about a second glass!

H_kMTF7vJwchxaN1SPPLsw.text: I went to Il Bosco with my mom and sister last night and it was fantastic! The small atmosphere is so fun, and the pizza was some of the best I've had in a long time. The owner and staff were all incredibly nice and very accommodating. This place is a gem in Scottsdale!

xVNQnhpB15dIM-3Hrsc7-g.text: Just awesome. Had the Biaagia and I was blown away by it's flavor and how crunch, yet chewy the pie crust was. They don't get cheap with their ingredients and offer the toppings generously. Nice fresh meat and vegetables.  Friendly staff, every time I come here.  Try the Caprese. It's incredibly fresh and delicious.

WkK-hVvukHApTs5_Up_Eyw.text: We ordered take-out from Il Bosco last night and was extremely pleased with the food but also the service. I wasn't expecting much since it was almost closing time and from my experience with other places is that the employees usually want to get out of there so theres attitude or a sense of being rushed to get me out the door, but when I arrived to pick up my order, the owned greeted me with such a cool calm and collected demeanor which  was such a pleasure, he even helped me carry my food and walked me out to my car. The place itself had a great atmosphere, I can see myself and my husband coming back to eat in next time! I would definitely recommend this place to my friends and family!

AGJj9jWa3tJcCHJ8PWAv8w.text: Been there twice for lunch. First time was pizza. Second time sandwitch.   The menu is inexpensive, however you dont get much. These are light faire. No stars taken off for that, just letting you all know that a pizza here is about a slice and a half by weight compared to a normal 18" pie. For me to get full I ordered a salad $6 and entre $6. You might be a smaller eater and get either or. The execption on pricing is the beverages. I ordered one ice tea and was unpleasantly surprised when I saw the bill for it was $5.75. EDIT: The ice tea was 2.75 and the tap water my coworker ordered was 3.00.

IF_8JlfF3e-H7TRbHs03zA.text: Best pizza in the valley without a doubt.  Absolutely excellent, better than Biancos, Pomo and some other very good places.  Had the kale and spinach caesar with pancetta.  It was incredible.  Also had "the Elana", pure heaven.  So flavorful.  My new favorite place.  Open on the weekends for lunch and dinner; during the week for dinner only.

OzL7moymmhsQCNjnM3WVAg.text: Some of the best homemade family-style pizza you could ask for is right here in the heart of Scottsdale.  Everything here is made with extreme attention to detail and the staff exudes this sense of family and graciousness in everything they make. Truly a mom and pop restaurant that's worth visiting again and again.   Don't forget to ask for their amazing creme brulee from their dessert menu, this stuff blows franchise restaurant Creme brulee's  out of the water and then top it with fresh fruit of the day.

ObYVddwmiQQdCk623WiBPw.text: Excellent pizza with fantastic ingredients. Ordered the Valentina with sausage and it was a wonderful spicy with sweet finish thanks to the honey they add. I highly recommend for a quality wood fired pizza.

ho3JYNSJAbaWKrJBqklRsA.text: Il Bosco was a very pleasant recommendation from a friend. We sat outside on the small patio and let the aroma of burning oak wood waft over us as we ate. We had the fried ravioli appetizer followed by the prosciutto, fig, & arugula pizza and the sausage & mushroom pizza. The pizza was delicious. I'd put it on par with another valley favorite, Pomo.   What made the experience special was meeting the owner Bill and his son. Bill is an example of a life well-lived and his warmth and enthusiasm was pleasant.   We don't live close by, but when in the area, I would definitely go back to Il Bosco.

9IngHqroa_DcjUfpB4NBuw.text: Our family was craving pizza and decided to give this place a try since there were so many good reviews and might I say it did not disappoint. The atmosphere is very cozy and the wait staff was phenomenal! They were so timely and personable, we loved it. I would highly recommend the Carmela and add mushrooms, best pizza I've had in quite a long time. It was very fresh and flavorful. If you're in the mood for a fresh wood fired pizza you definitely need to give this place a try!

Vbx7qZuoDwA4LHf3y10Eew.text: Amazing food! Great atmosphere! Mr. Forest himself went to of his way to explain all of the food/specials to us!   The short rib pizza was probably our favorite, but nothing a disappointed!

FTWDhVR4F8Dzr18GjNr6Wg.text: We have gone here twice so far and both times we were very happy with our pizza. We usually call in and pick it up with no issues. The owner seems really nice and the restaurant is beautiful. We have yet to sit down and eat there but I am sure it would also be a great experience. We take our pizza seriously so it's always refreshing when we have awesome pizza choices nearby.

OD7SL_HSbo38GyskeJV80A.text: Weather was beautiful so we sat outside.  Great service and the pizza was very flavorful.  The restaurants uses quality ingredients from the organic flour, simple yet tasteful tomatoes for the sauce, and olive oil.   The pizzas are simple yet packed with flavor.  Will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

-SaVUTIUDnnRxHsaY0cm1A.text: Small yet perfect. I always worry if there will be room for me but some how there always is. I love this food! I love this restaurant! I get the Mia pizza, its heavy but it is so good. They have a wonderful small staff. Food to go and food there, both are amazing!

ROqud8Z7nHbVX9ffd1Hd9w.text: Loved the pizza and atmosphere is intimate and fun! Have the Valentina spicy with a bit of sweet it's awesome!!!

i2HnSM3AQqNAv_qE5w_HjA.text: It was ok. Ex New Yorker, like the pizza.  Small wine pours, limited menu,waiter a bit unpleasant...when finished seemed like they wanted us out of there quickly. Not impressed. Music next door not great. Probably won't go back.

7JmaVS7XJt6mz9Z-Z2VmqQ.text: The pizza was so authentic, it brought us right back to our summer in Rome. The ingredients are fresh and wonderfully prepared. We got the Valentina and the Biaggia; both were very special, with great complexity of flavor. However, I'm not sure what all is included in the dining experience. For example, we got complimentary olives, but larger groups got bread and olive oil too. Large groups also had a water decanter on their tables for refills. We were sort of neglected after we got our pizzas and were left sitting without any water for most of our meal. Furthermore, some tables had flowers, others didn't. Since the restaurant is really only open during the evening, I would suggest a candle on each table, instead. This would be more cost effective, and would give the space an even more romantic vibe. Lastly, my amoretto was complimentary at the end of my meal. It was incredible (like butter), but the restaurant shouldn't just be giving that away for free....it's too good. Bottom line, everything needs to be consistent. Every table, every group (no matter the size) should have the same service and experience. That being said, I loved the food here, and would gladly return.

CISSnkbfCrFQO9ntDAmFNA.text: One of the best pizza places in the valley. Very small inside but the food is fantastic and the service is awesome.   Nice touches of comp olives and bread.   Expensive wine by the glass but decent selection.   Definitely worth the drive from Chandler.

ognOXvFkqp1xxmz5ply67g.text: Delicious find that we discovered after tailing a pizza oven on wheels (turned out Il Bosco was catering an event in our neighborhood). Start g from the fabulous in-house brined olives to the delectable bread to the fabulous roasted rappinni & garlic to the cheese salsa the the amazing pizzas, this place in an undiscovered scottsdale treasure! Just remember it is closed in the month of July, so get there soon!

photos.caption: Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mamma Mia that&#39;s a good pizza!
Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

NqGbm4WTUtFq7ff9OzENcw.text: My guy and I have been to Il Bosco twice now and it is quickly becoming one of our favorite pizza places.  Both times we got the meatball appetizer, a salad and a pizza.   The meatballs are delish - not spicy but very flavorful and the sauce is great for dipping the bread that they give you.  We've had the traditional Caesar and the kale spinach salad. Between the two we definitely preferred the kale spinach. The Caesar has a thinner dressing on it that isn't bad, it's just not the creamy Caesar I was hoping for. I believe the same dressing is on the kale spinach salad and it fits better with the thicker kale. Plus the kale spinach has pancetta on it - can't go wrong there.  The pizza is definitely the standout here. The crust is done perfectly - not charred and not soggy in the middle. The sauce has a nice flavor and the toppings are placed in just the right amount.  The owner has been there both times and is very warm and welcoming. On our second visit his son was our waiter and was very pleasant as well. The service is fast and the atmosphere friendly.   We will definitely be returning. How else would we become Il Bosco regulars?

8vfQOR6gwJgQrMTph02vcQ.text: Best wood fired pizza in the Valley - my wife loves the Biaggia - I like to check the specials (last year, when they were in season, they had a Hatch Chile pizza that was the best pizza ever!).  Bianco?  Pomo?  pfffttt!  - Il Bosco!!!  Great pizza, cool vibe - check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Daily special - pepperoni and jalapeño - awesome combo!

_eCHHNLpLXyL_EnY47pJzQ.text: Super sweet and attentive (without being overly attentive) service and fabulous food - we had the caprese, kale caesar and the kids had plain pepperoni pizza - we had the sausage and onion (dee-lish)!  And the beers were amazing! Pleasantly surprised at how wonderful this restaurant was.  Outdoor seating was the perfect temperature at 6pm-ish in April!

8qzSfjmYp0X0C-OSO7U-CQ.text: Il Bosco aka "The Forest".  Excellent wood fired pizza and wine!  Good lay-back atmosphere.  This place is a little hole in the wall located in a strip mall.  You might drive right by it and miss it.  They have seating outside so when the weather cools down that would be a plus.  My only complaint is they weren't that busy and our waitress hovered and tried to take away plates when we were still eating.  All in all, I'd give it another try because the pizza was so good.  PS - they need to work on their Caesar Salad.  Dry and tasteless.  If they made homemade dressing it could be a star.

photos.caption: Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

xJDF75ogb87zF1uUSGOluA.text: Aaaaah!! I love this place!  Fantastic food in a casual environment, and the staff treats customers so well.  It's tiny, so everyone is up in everyone's business which creates this happy family atmosphere.  Can't wait to go back!

VTb_2rNDwdUQahmxpItZag.text: Great food, awesome service. Best pizza in Scottsdale.  The owner and his family are super nice and it feels like you're part of their family. I would recommend this establishment to all

wY9_lhwE746LG6VUpcUOiQ.text: Best pizza I've had in Scottsdale. Wonderful staff. what can I say- this place is great!!

A-8elxABZEXxYVBXL4vR0A.text: Ok, seriously???  This place is still awesome.  The last time I was in was over six months ago and when I visited just recently, the owner, Bill came out and said, "I think this is yours, you left it last time."  (A scarf) Can you believe that? Thought I should share the good news.  Food is still amazing and the service..... 5 star.

dwJk2o26g58iw5-zIPfwhA.text: The best wood fire pizza I have ever eaten.  Good variety, indoor and outdoor seating.  Owner came by our table to ask about the meal.  Decent beer selection (local).  The charge of a couple bucks for tap water is something that the owner needs to reconsider, leaves a bad taste after a great meal.  Upcharge something else to make up for this.  Otherwise great pizza.

xdKjgv9SnepI449-nrV2nA.text: Great place for great pizza done right. The owner is always on site and the service is spot on.

4Yw9phe7QyNmBjvpgQwZFQ.text: This is some seriously good pizza!  We read the reviews on Yelp, and gave it a shot last night.  We called in our order, and the staff was very friendly on the phone, and explained that they would not put the pizzas in the oven until we got their, so that they would be fresh and hot for us to eat.  We got the Dona and the Biaggia.  I was worried that they would be tiny after some of the reviews, but they were both a decent size and bursting with flavor.  I was a little reluctant to try fig on a pizza, but the previous reviews told me I had to.  It's a winner!  If you have not gone here yet, give it a shot.  Very excellent pizza for not a lot of dough!

UCP5KQEK0HhNIbgd1l-dfw.text: This is the best pizza in the valley.  It is a small pizzeria, tucked away in a quiet shopping center.  Use your navigation system because it is worth finding.  The pizza is amazing.  I love the Biaggia.  The desserts are excellent too.  The owner is personable and friendly.  I can't imagine anyone having a problem with this place unless they expected a large, hip restaurant.  In that case, they can have their crappy pizza.  My husband and I will keep returning to Il Bosco.

bMERFGV9yE19sN44U1N5ag.text: food was good place was quaint and fills up fast so go early or extra late. we all tried different pizzas which are fire baked, was it the best pizza ever no... but definitely worth another visit

CccX5p6aBh1EJgJSbxWT0g.text: Awesome wood fired pizza!  My husband and I just happened to drive by and decided to try Il Bosco and are so glad we did!  We shared a Caprese salad and a pizza and it was PLENTY for the two of us.  The Caprese was seriously the best I have had.  It had house made mozzarella and was drizzled with yummy balsamic glaze, olive oil, and a pesto sauce.  We got the Elana pizza - salami and Gaeta olives.  SO good!  We are so happy to have found such a gem so close to our home!

7qzejAX0Zrew7r91U78CYg.text: The pizza is very cheesy and delicious. Their sodas are just fresh and amazing. The owner Bill is very nice. The whole place is very comforting. If possible, I would rate this place 933 stars!!!!!

QwO6yJs1kKBpDgdZSGv3CA.text: They must have changed chefs,the salad was over saturated and crutons tasted old hard as a rock.

DUBVSugWB2mxER4WlOFsvA.text: Just had our first pizzas from Bosco. Great pies, great flavor. Nice people too. Only dissapointment was the Ceaser salad. Overpriced for a simple small dinner salad.

IGXed2_11Q_DOSRQsPj_Lg.text: We're staying nearby at the Hyatt Regency for a weekend getaway and wanted a change of scene with a small local restaurant that would appeal to me, my husband, and 5-year-old son--and weren't disappointed with this choice.  We sat outside on a pleasant evening and enjoyed a couple of pizzas, Caesar salad, wine, and gelato. Pizza was nicely crusty and slightly charred at the edges. Staff was kind, vibe was good, a winner all around.

crWO1V3VMdldckLk2zxvhg.text: Best wood burning gourmet pizza ever!!!  We loved it and our kids loved it!  Fresh ingredient and the crust is cooked to perfection, not too thin and too deep.  We spoke to the chef and he is super nice and friendly and it was really quick!  Love the little restaurant but it is small and it gets packed during dinner time.  Lunch was great and their lunch prices can't be beat!

ILxQKZtjV3SI9mA8p71Y-g.text: Hard to find and very small but would go back many times. Great pizza and very friendly staff. Snug and cozy works well at this wonderful find.

w7_RrWEBIEJDgezT75OYAg.text: Every visit is as great as the last!  We love to introduce locals as well as out-of-towners to this best in class pizza place.  What a special gem.  Another Phoenix downtown pizza place has garnered much nation wide coverage, but night for night we would pick Il Bosco over Bianca's!  And importantly, you don't have to wait 2 to 4 hours!  You won't find a better pizza in all of Arizona!  Not to forget, the Caesar salad is a winner too!

XMDWh_ohc3clyAqcogvI4Q.text: I've been to Italy for pizza. Now I go to Il Bosco. It is great!

9Tjimc68VgurUJKXgg2Pgg.text: Well, we were swayed by the reviews and good press, so we went.  Not overly impressed, but I guess it is in what one is looking for.  This place has one size pizza, 11 inch, and a pizza variety limited to eight or so.  None are standard Italian fare.  Salads are limited to two pretty ordinary selections.  Our pizza was VERY salty, with a remarkable blandness.  My wife, who has a very limited capacity for pizza was still hungry after we split a salad and a pizza.  Also, beware ordering the $3 bottle of water.  It is very large but non-branded.  Folks who like this type of pizza are those taken with botique kinds of food given a liking for something non-traditional.   Pizza Bianco folks would be happy with this as would Barrio Mexican food fans.  For us, these offerings were lacking in flavor, spice and quantity.  I'm sure the quality of ingredients is good as the proprietor seems to take great care with his product.  However, in the final analysis, we cannot agree with any 5 star rating.  PS.  The owner responded to my comments saying he was happy to be compared to Pizza Bianco and Barrio.  I wasn't suggesting those spots were bad.  However, what they offer is  "Foofey Food."   If that is the kind of fare one likes, so be it.  For those looking for something more substantial, "Foofey Food" doesn't do the trick.

-wT06GEm2DVKF-_jlQapkg.text: Food was great, prices were incredibly reasonable for the quality of the food,  the best caprese salad appetizer you will ever have , pizza was cooked to perfection with layers of flavors and textures, get the goat cheese and Fig house specialty, you won't regret it ! Dont forgot to enjoy the home made amaretto to finish off a special meal. Enjoy Italy for one night in Scottsdale. Cheers.

qjmUsMYUC2baJM7wpfZ3Ag.text: I searched on Yelp for "best pizza in Scottsdale", and this came up #1.  I thought it was great.  The service was wonderful.  The pizza was great, probably thanks to the wood oven.

wDpcgTCCrGv54KhHO0u5hA.text: Tried it out on 7/3/12 with my husband and 2 friends. We each ordered a different pizza so we got to try a nice variety. Loved the pizza especially the crispy crust. Very fresh ingredients. There is no reason to drive into Phoenix for pizza at Bianco or Cibo when this gem is in the neighborhood! I will be back.

yQ2_4VoaVkr9_lL8lXKxvw.text: This hidden gem offers delicious food with an authentic Italian ambiance. The menu is simple, yet incredibly flavorful. The ingredients are fresh and the wood fired pizza oven cooks everything to perfection!

K7fjUkVOhqULF_R9fbbagQ.text: Wish I could give more stars. But ... thought we would try this a second time. Same results. Two pizzas , the Sausage & mushroom was mediocre. The pepperoni & mushroom was over cooked & dry. We each ate two pizzas & tossed the rest. The capris salad was good. Hubbie thought the meatballs were good also.

R-STZrKiJ1vllgohDTlttg.text: our friends recommended this pizza place and we have tried their pizza when it was catered to their house. This is our new pizza place. Authentic pizza not loaded with a lot of toppings and not too doughy. They come in one size only, 12 inch. They brought out small tray of 10 olives to nibble on. We started with Cesar Salad,$7.5; glass of Chianti $9 and Boylan Root Beer, $3.5. Followed by the Adrianna pizza and Lucia Pizza, 11.5 and 13.5 respectively. The Lucia pizza had sausage and mushrooms which was proportional and the crust was yummy. You could actually taste the mushrooms because they were quartered instead of sliced. My wife enjoyed her pizza and mentioned that if we want pizza, this is where she wants it. We finished our meal with a Lemon Sorbetto which was an actually lemon hollowed out and the sorbet was packed into it. Refreshing!! When you come, parking can be a problem and you might have to park north, a block away.

photos.caption: Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ilL4OemnhT6dF-dO7-qDDQ.text: There are no words to reccomend this restaurant enough. I worked with Jeff the plan my mother's birthday for 20 people. He made it clear from the beginning how much he cared about us. The service was absolutely excellent. We will definitely be back! There aren't a lot of restaurants that truly care about their customers, but this is one of them. Definitely visit!!

Fybf0wjrAdKutz4F-h5biw.text: The owner Jeff is very passionate about IL Bosco and will go to great lengths to make sure you have a great experience. We personally had an issue with some delivery food, but we worked together to trace the problem back to grub hub. I look forward to an opportunity to dine on premises. Thanks Jeff.

Kgw76TQBYN7nYRGhmz6hiQ.text: We had a pizza the owner recommended...called Jeff's wife's sister pizza. It was spicy and amazing.  You need to ask for it. Go for it! 5 stars all around

2m9ZCRHJ6BJ_U7aYllAO4Q.text: It pains me to give this place a one star review because for so many years it was the best pizza in town and was family  owned and had such a warm hospitality to it. But now it is not. It is not the same place. It is not the same people. It is not worth going to as the new owners have no idea what they are doing and the quality has gone down hill.

0yWiWTywllqT4uQ0pqSjmw.text: NOT THE SAME since the Forrest family is no longer involved. Wish I could give zero stars. The quality is awful and all of the love has left the building. We will not be back and it's a shame as this USED TO BE our favorite pizza place.

jA7cYwWFB8TJR8P-2bNPMw.text: I own a small business in the area and when my clients ask for a recommendation I always sent them to Il Bosco. It was small family owned business with incredible food and a great vibe. It has since changed dramatically and I will no longer be a customer or sending any business that way. Bill and his sons knew every patron and treated them like family. The new owners have no idea what they are doing and it shows in the quality. Such a sad thing to happen to a staple of the community.

00r_Dc7DKVrWRyLNEobOsQ.text: This place used to be awesome.  Then new people stepped in and bought it after the great proprietor passed. The sons were doing a great job, but they aren't there anymore. And now I won't be either. Ambience is GONE.

gv913qO4ffZ8fBEq2xa_AQ.text: What a SHAME! Il Bosco was once a wonderful family owned business with delicious food and a warm, welcoming environment. Sadly, this is no longer True as the restaurant has been purchased in a shady and disreputable way. The food and staff have changed completely... I will not be returning.

eC9EvuWkRhrN-LO4yYvUSw.text: I've been coming here for years, visiting Bill and the family. I've always considered this place my go-to spot when in need. After my most recent visit, I was upset to learn that the family had been pushed out by new ownership, which was extremely evident. Not only was our order incorrect, but the ambiance was gone. It's a shame because this once was our best kept secret. Will not be coming back.

3PhtVyYyncwPtZVP1JxUAQ.text: Really enjoyed my meal at il Bosco pizzaria. The restaurant was small and had a quaint feel. Wood fired pizza is my favorite. I was with a group who ordered 3 pies which were all delicious. I didn't have the peppers stuffed with sausage but apparently they are "to die for".

McT4GMdjpD1yYEIRI-9_GA.text: Great pizza right here in Arizona! Awesome to have this new restaurant around I definitely recommend anyone try it out!

OLGik5N5IGQy0vlyTdG2Dw.text: Let's just cut to the chase!  IL Bosco Pizza is a terrific pizza restaurant on every level!  The food, the ambiance, and the service, is all top notch!  The owner, Jeff (who personally came to my table to introduce himself, and thank me for coming in), my server, Carter, and server assistant Emily, were all wonderful, and made my visit a 10!!  And the food....WOW!   Honesty, I have never had a better pizza in my life, and I consider myself quite the connoisseur!  In closing; you want pizza? Go to IL Bosco on Becker Ln in Scottsdale!!  You won't be sorry.

jZDELGYY1gv1Hcawo24Jtg.text: Came for lunch and stayed for happy hour! Ordered a custom pizza recommended by the owner. Did not disappoint!

3Sha8r1_dzfaCXiM5MK79A.text: My wife and I moved from NYC to Scottsdale about 10 months ago and it's been a struggle finding good pizza until we came across this little gem.  All the ingredients are top notch from the cheese to the crust which is made is house  on par with lamp pizza in north Scottsdale.

3FOQhHdlUCvRlrBJuvDUIg.text: What a wonderful little find.  Family owned and everyone cares.  Service was with a smile and food was delicious.  I had the biaggia pizza...prociutto, fig jam, quattro formaggio and arugula...wonderful.  my husband had the Lucia pizza....sausage and mushrooms - it was great.  Will definitely be back.  Small place with more outdoor seating than inside.  Try it...you'll like it!

G7kVD1CVAJv-aNgobzIvAA.text: Paid a visit with my family to this quaint little pizza place last week and it was nothing short of amazing! Coming from Europe, I love small, family, authentic type of restaurants and IL Bosco just reminded me of that! We were served freshly baked in the house bread with olives upon arrival and oh my it was delicious! We ordered stuffed peppers with sausage, burrata, spinach & kale salad and few pizzas - let's just say we enjoyed every bit of it! Definitely new favorite place for authentic Italian pizza!

uksAgaKUVpgXEgq_J1mEfg.text: Great service, Awesome pizza and great desserts.  Great little place with amazing pizzas. Hatch green chili pizza is a must try!

Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

hpt22otKiKU6T-Wgf0HB0w.text: Great, great, great food.  Thoroughly enjoyed the pizza, service and atmosphere.  I will definitely go back to this restaurant for another meal

p6Z4vuHKc8kH2hJPAr_M5Q.text: Amazing food and not just the pizza! We got the meatballs which were delish and the olive oil that we dipped our bread into was very sweet. The pizzas are perfectly per portioned and the crust perfectly cooked.   The owner was the one that served us and told us that the names of the pizzas have a story behind them which was fun to hear some of them.   It's an eclectic restaurant with church pews for some seating and unmatched chairs and tables which I loved. We sat outside because the weather is great this time of year.   What we ordered: Meatballs- juicy and tender and hot! The "Adrianna" pizza  because my fiance's nieces name is that and the "Gia" which was amazing.  PROS: everything CONS: nothing  We have found our go to spot now :)

PErs6rRIj8LSU7WqvYHalg.text: Best pizza in AZ!!!!! Having been from the east coast, I know pizza quite well. And during my 5 years living out there, this was hands down my spot! The owner is very friendly and his product is reminiscent of the pizza I got back in NY!!!

89UQF0R9VU8ox8ptSVSbFg.text: I generally don't write reviews after 1 visit unless things were really great or really horrible. I had seen this place on yelp and it was pretty highly rated and I had a cousin visiting from out of town so I thought, pizza, why not, lets try Il Bosco!  We walked in the door and we were immediately greeted by "we have no room" from a white haired man named Bill (who I later deduced was the owner because he had his tweenage son working there as well). Hi to you too!   Alas he found us some space at the bar. I set my things down at the bar, and I happened to have a bottle of water with me that I didn't want to leave to roast in the car because it's Phoenix in July and that would be a waste. I had every intention of ordering a drink. He confiscated my bottle of water and placed it behind his counter, looked at me like I was some sort of village idiot and asked me if I brought my own food in for him to cook, too. I was dumbfounded. He only returned the water after my mom insisted she would put it away.   After reviewing the menu I ordered the Elana pizza without salami, as my cousins requested. Again, I got the you're-an-idiot face from Bill, and a "you just want a pizza with olives?" Why yes, sir, is that gonna be okay with you? I'm freakin paying aren't I? He did seem to be very friendly with customers that he knew or were regulars. Sorry you didn't give us that chance.   I was literally OVERWHELMED by the condescension. And then to add the icing on the cake he kept coming by to make sure everything was great and acted all reverent and friendly when we got done and were leaving. Its too freaking bad, Bill. Because Brent(?) and Gerardo and even your son Max were all lovely human beings and the pizza was pretty good too.   But if I wanna feel like an idiot I'll take a calculus class, not come to your pizza joint. Wont be returning.

TxEmw6KYyvWZ4opCpL_enw.text: Your standard Neapolitan pizza set up that gets a couple of bonus points for its mobility and flair for getting creative with their pies.

cMG5oTmP4Dy2apUjF8X-oQ.text: Pretty authentic Napoli style pizza place. Tastes great, and they have good salads and wines as well.

0LpfD40VEQZqygaSH7elDw.text: Just plain awesome pizza and staff.  Kinda hard to find but you should definitely seek them out.  This will be our new Scottsdale pizza stop!

A01yBIdOJGADOI5DxkAD2Q.text: We have been here twice now and love everything about it! The owner is very passionate and involved in his restaurant. He was serving customers, busing tables, and even sat down to have a conversation with us. The brick oven pizza is excellent! We also had the fried ravioli, which was a special of the night and the house made red sauce that came with it was the real deal. Beautiful property.. Would definitely recommend this place.

p4oHTvWXvGD4HgU9RKXC4w.text: WE LOVE il Bosco.   cute little sit down restaurant. I would imagine little cafe's in europe to be like their place.  The pizza's here are amazing. My wife ordered the one (forget the name) but they said it was their best seller. Obviously know why because it was AMAZING. mine was good, but her pizza made mine taste like crap.   If you like olives they serve a small tray of it before your food. I am not  a big fan of olives so this wasn't a big deal to me. But my wife loved it!

fC4HV4KIKky2_a62LekhoQ.text: Just went here and really loved it.  The owner is pleasant without being obnoxious.  The pizzas lie somewhere in between a high quality American style pizza and a Napoletana pizza.  We had a caprese salad with high quality tomatoes and medium quality mozzarella.  The basil, olive oil dressing was wonderful.  The pizzas are tasty with excellent ingredients.    The atmosphere is simply wonderful and cozy.  It's a small space but interesting and nicely decorated.  For amazingness I still rank Pomo #1 for pizza, Andreoli #2 (they only serve pizza a couple of nights a week) and Bosco is in the next category.  This is a great place so make sure and give it a try.

photos.caption: Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Delicious Insalata Caprese--great basil, olive oil dressing.

qvAMRsDp6v9OKPgYix_BBA.text: If you want some of the best tasting pizzas with a creative flair at an awesome price without then attitude---Go here!!!!!   Food was great, we were surprised when the chef came over and gave us a taste platter of olive oils breads and even there own home made olives. My wife and I had a great time. We are going there again.

Yx6q1U9Cq95jDe5SvRE0Jg.text: If you're looking for gourmet wood fired oven pizza, this is the place to go!  The prosciutto, fig, goat cheese, arugula pizza is absolutely delicious!

TxrZB1RbLiy44I8-SNa9zw.text: This is the finest pizza in Scottsdale and maybe all of Arizona. You're crazy if you don't come here and have a dinner. Service is wonderful and you can sit out door on the patio.

_Lk8LkeJGKT9QG3DhwBhaQ.text: I came here on a double date with the Tasia, her brother and his wife. That in itself made the night a blast because to be very blunt and straight forward, her brother and I are hilarious and we make every occasion fun. So, if you need to liven up a party, give me a call, we will jump in his truck and rock your world  Now for the pizza. We came for the pizza, and we loved it. The pizza was delicious. We got 3 different pies ( 2 biaggias). We loved the pie biaggia, that was every ones favorite. We also had the Joanna and Lucia. I loved them all - they were delicious.   Why 3 stars:  1) We waited like 15 minutes for everyone to get a water. They ran out of glasses...This was ridiculous, and we got refiled about once in the hour and a half we were there  2) we were sitting outside, and the heat lamp was broken...tough to enjoy the meal when your shivering - This was in February, so hopefully some of the kinks have been worked out.  3) the meatball appetizer was subpar. Small portions, 3 tiny meatballs, and they were nothing to write home about  4) I like that they have boylan soda brands, but seriously, I would rather have refills on ice tea and a soda on tap then spend 2.75 for like a sip of coke  I will def come back here for the pizza. It is awesome, but I will bring a bottle of water with me

CNEfg-hxuDQxrmJReH7FgA.text: My husband and I first learned about Il Bosco when they were catering a friend's party. I thought the mobile wood fired oven was a great idea. It was parked in the driveway, and the pizzas were served up fresh.   Since then, we've visited the restaurant numerous times. We usually go for lunch as the 8 inch size pizza is just right. All of the toppings are good. The crust is super. It's crispy on the outside and tender inside. The fresh made dough has a good taste, too. It is as close to the pizza in Italy as we've found.  The owner, Bill, is usually there. His hospitality is great, too. There is a nicely arranged patio up front. t's a small, friendly local place. Try it!

E5pGrWqKPUqo0UEqIoN_sw.text: A small restaurant that does provide some amazing pizza. Had a simple pizza with sausage and pepperoni and was just amazing. I like how they serve their olives as a snack for the customers. It may be hard to find but it is right next to the handlebar.

z9z7D7j2cQWCF4eIg61Auw.text: I don't get it.  Highest rated restaurant in this area??  Do not be suckered.  Service was poor with zero personality.  No water was served or even offered.  Wine served in a cheap juice glass.  Only two beers on the menu, two.  Oily Caesar.  Pizza was okay.  People review this place like they've never had a wood fired pizza before.  Trust me, go to il Capo up the street for a better experience in every way.  Or even Gramaldi's.  Yelpers, you are often right on, but you let us down this time.

hTjuGF4uPuuxscyQPYdIIg.text: Bill and his crew treat everyone like family. The food is excellent and at-home hospitality cannot be beaten. We've been here a dozen (or more) times and have never been disappointed.

4GTyFSybc4em237Gv3BiCg.text: I just found this review saved as a draft from my trip to Scottsdale in March. I still feel just as strongly about it today...  I can honestly say that my meal at il bosco tonight was one of the best overall meals I've ever had. I can not think of a single thing I would change about this place, aside from putting it in my neighborhood at home in Denver. From the stellar service to absolutely delicious food to comfortable ambience they have truly done everything right. Trust me when I say that the reviews do not lie.

OH_onYhVQ9aEj5EmmbzelQ.text: I found Il Bosco on Yelp and came because it had so many 5 star ratings. It's for good reason this little hole in the wall has garnered such positive remarks.  First thing: it's tough to find, but don't give up. The restaurant can be found behind their portable wood fire pizza oven. Once inside, wave to the owner. He's wearing a white chef coat and has grey hair. Even if you don't wave, count on a table side visit.   Second: he's a former golf pro who tired of traveling and thought opening a restaurant would be fun.   Third: get the homemade meatballs to start. Delicious and served on a plate of homemade tomato sauce that's also delicious.  Fourth: order the Joanna or Biaggia. Every pie comes in just one size. The Joanna has hot Italian sausage that's home made. The Biaggia is the PERFECT combination of sweet and savory. Yes, it has figs in it and yes, they are delicious.   Fifth: be prepared to come home with money in your pocket because Il Bosco is very affordable.  I brought two buddies from SoCal and all agreed we would return. Lots of people talk about Pizzaria Bianco, and for good reason. Il Bosco is right there in terms of food quality but you don't have to wait four hours. It's the PERFECT local Pizzaria.

0zaugZ7JsjbyrVR_B8rN2g.text: Look, I understand people dillude themselves into thinking a restaurant that's contrarian and hip has food that magically tastes better.   And don't get me wrong, the pizza here was good. But not great.   The place is a dive, which is usually find, but the place smelled like bug spray. The server (I think owner, too) was nice, but not overly friendly.   The food was certainly fast, and the bread was good.   Overall, the place is fine. But it's getting great reviews simply because it's counter-culture and organic.

F_K58fZQreXx9ihEeKJoaQ.text: Found this place after a quick scan of Yelp and we were very glad we did. Excellent food, service, and healthy wine pours...what more could you want? We started with the meatballs and they were phenomenal...a must try! After the first glass of wine was finished I ordered another and was pleasantly surprised to find around half a bottle in my glass, what service!! Finally, the main course arrived and the pizza was phenomenal. Crispy crust which you would expect at a wood fired pizza joint and the freshest ingredients. You can tell they really take pride in their food...   In summary, if you want pizza in the Scottsdale area look no further than il Bosco!!!

IXqh_w3cGE14LuWNIxw3Qg.text: My daughter found this in Yelp when we were in town on vacation from the East Coast.  Four of us went and ate indoors.  Small casual place with a wonderful owner.   We ordered the salsa, the stuffed peppers, the toasted ravioli, caprese, and one Eggplant pizza for all of us to share.  This was more than enough for the four of us, especially since we were originally not that hungry but wanted to try the various antipasto dishes.  The stuffed peppers aren't the large green peppers, but small red peppers with a nice bite to them and delicious sausage inside.   The bread was delicious.  My mother doesn't usually like cheese (except on pizza) but she liked the toasted ravioli so much that she wants to learn how to make them.  The caprese had fresh mozzarella and sliced cherry tomatoes.  The pizza was superb.  A nice change not to have breaded fried eggplant on a pizza but fresh cubed eggplant.  Everyone there was so nice and the food was delicious and came out quickly.   We were able to enjoy the food without feeling rushed.  I would definitely go back if we are in the area again and recommend it.

VbzdyOXd-fFDGJ3OLLbI5Q.text: I cannot recommend this place enough. The food, staff and location are fantastic. Quaint but very happy and the salads and pizza are fantastic. Their prices are so reasonable you can afford to come often - and should .  We are visiting from out of town and found this place on Yelp. Great find!

s-awjKOPx7lWWpwjBW6LIw.text: Great neighborhood restaurant! Went for the first time for a late dinner and was very impressed. Adorable, chic, intimate restaurant that feels very authentic Italian. The menu is simple and straight forward, again a nod to True Italian Pizza and Salad.   A friend and I split the Kale and Spinach caesar (excellent flavor)  and the fig, prosciutto, arugula, and goat cheese pizza. Literally the pizza had all my favorite flavors in one, and with the perfect crust it was excellent. Great over all restaurant and will be back again soon!

4h8UnqZjculwsLqlmq7NPA.text: I'd like to say it was good but we haven't had a chance to eat there recently. The last three times we've gone in the owners tell us they're closed, this time closing in 10 min and then give us a blank stare. That was at 8:10 on a Saturday night! Look the pizza is good, the appetizers not so much, we've been going there for years but this is a new thing, closing at 8:20? Looks like they're doing so well they don't need our business anymore. Pomo pizza a few minutes away sure was happy to have us.

-0nRRzLW3oiTyo0Z_jsmaA.text: The most fantastic pizza, appetizers, and lovely service.  Do not miss the homemade amaretto! Like liquid butter!  I could not be any happier! We go out every Sunday but this was by far the best Sunday meal we've had for a very very long time!

vFvPGNKSAY7x0_xTD77U8A.text: Great vibe ! Delicious  Pizza. Will be back often.

Smam6JFnHoox4dEQrLQ0JQ.text: This place is a bit cozy, but once you've settled in it's not very noticeable.  The set up is very shabby chic, but its clean and appealing.  The owner runs the service very well.  He was on top of all his customers' needs the whole way through, directing the kitchen and the supporting waitress and chipping in himself to make sure everything was well.  The complimentary bread looked disastrous - it was cold and looked like it was undercooked.  One bite though and it was the best Italian bread we'd ever had.  The flavor was so good.  The caesar salad was also excellent.  We had the mushroom and sausage pizza, which unfortunately was burnt.  It was a bit bitter, or else we probably would've eaten the whole pizza.  The red pepper flakes were super flavorful which I appreciated a lot - most places' flakes are stale and doesn't provide this much kick.    So usually the burnt pizza at a pizza place would definitely lose a star or two, but I can't help but love this place.  The owner was so nice, and even gave us some homemade amaretto that was off the charts.  It was great on our dessert of chocolate covered ball of chocolate, pistachio and strawberry gelatos.  The hospitality of the place, the quality of the food and service, and the set up of the place are why I'm a super fan of this restaurant.  I'm hoping the pizza will be good next time too!

Z_90K94H8J3Zm4yCeozMMQ.text: Place is amazing!!! Pizza was the best hands down. So close to real Italian couldn't believe!! Highly recommend to try!!!

I8MQJh52Bn9DnLqGu0Mkyw.text: Wonderful! If you are a fan of thin crust pizza without overpowering sauce - THIS IS IT! 7nE9MhTUjmKMPDU8bWjA3A.text: Really good wood-fired pizza with top-quality ingredients.  The specials are exceptional, especially the eggplant, caper and olive if it's available.

ahmoCxOxn0P62qt_wOBRxw.text: Excellent food. Very small seating area and eccentric owner, but this actually makes the experience so unique. Not your run-of-the-mill pizza place. Very authentic brick oven pizza. I go often with my family.

ppFiDuXuat11HailTJ-ZAQ.text: Excellent service, quaint, adorable ambience, and wonderful food!!   I was greeted by an incredibly kind manager who took me to my table and also checked back twice throughout our meal. Our server (I wish I could remember her name!) gave excellent, thoughtful service and went above and beyond to accommodate our requests.   The entire staff works like a team - anyone who brought us plates or drinks was equally as friendly and attentive. This is a great little gem in North Scottsdale definitely worth checking out.   I especially recommend it for date night on the patio - very romantic and intimate setting. I look forward to coming back!

xLtS1K9TmK9wAwGzzQyalA.text: I just went back to Ct. for  the wedding of my business partner (one of the greatest events I have ever attended) and visited World Famous Pepe Pizza in New Haven, Ct. on a Sunday Night with my Mom and nephew to do a direct comparison of Bill (Scottsdale) vs. the Legend (Frank Pepe: New Haven, CT)  ...  Do a Yelp search ... Frank Pepe Pizza, New Haven, CT ... they are world famous.  Ronald Reagan and Frank Sinatra used to have pizza flown to them from New Haven, Ct. as it was so highly regarded.  When I lived in Ct, we would drive from Middletown to New Haven at least once a month.  The final results are in ... (Frank Pepe will not be happy)  Bill in Scottsdale is better (it even surprised me) ... Everyone who reads this should give Ill Bosco one try and understand that the absolute MOST delicious pizza in America is in of all places Scottsdale, Arizona and produced by someone who was once the premiere PGA Golf Coach in America (2006 PGA Golf Coach of the Year)  in a location that is virtually impossible to find.    How is this possible?  ... Most of the pizza in Arizona is sub-standard and everyone living here knows it  ...  You mention going out for pizza in Arizona and most everyone from back east figures they are going to suffer through a lousy meal.  But Bill has done something different.  In a state filled with mediocrity (or less), he has taken pizza to an art form.  You think Pizza Bianco with all their national publicity  is Number 1 in the state of Arizona ??? ... WRONG ... Yes Bianco has great pizza (i've eaten there and enjoyed it even though they have the most uncomfortable seating as everyone is packed together like sardines), but Ill Bosco is better (check the other YELP reviews to see if i am just blowing smoke).  And eating at Bill's is comfortable ... plenty of elbow room and a vibe that makes you appreciate Scottsdale ... you just want to sit and enjoy which is something very rare in 2014.  And to top it all off the owner is a Gem ... When you walk in, it's like being part of a family.  You won't be coming just once ... Give it a try ... You'll see.

02c3GgxhjA38gUvdg0CmVQ.text: Great pizza and friendly service. We had tr biaggia (goat cheese, fig, prosciutto, arugula, and parm) and the Dona (fresh tomato, pancetta, and cheese) - both were great. The crust is crisp with a great chew and good flavor. We also tried the meatballs which are small but flavorful with a touch of fennel for extra flavor. The fried ravioli is a far cry from the fried ravioli you're probably used to and definitely worth a try. I will definitely be back.

XJotwIHos9cmMWtokwd_HA.text: Been here a few times, think its time I finally write a review. Just love the pizzas here!! There are few things that I think makes the pizzas great here. The crust is amazing, really holds the weight of the pizza well, crisp all the way. The tomato sauce is fresh and tastes amazing, we tried the pesto the last time we were here, that was great too. The toppings are all great, love the spicy sausage and the pepperoni. Lastly, the thing I really love is that the pizza is not overly salty. You can taste each ingredient without the sauce or the salt overpowering the flavors. Love the cute setup as well and the Italian style tumblers for wine. Too hot now but they have a nice patio too. We'll keep coming back!!

8C-BY2FasB9Lupx--Xpm7w.text: Wow. I made the special trip to Scottsdale to try out this pizza place. It is a small quaint little place. There was no available seating inside so we had to eat outside. If I were to come again, I would wait until Winter, because eating outside when it is over 100 degrees is really not enjoyable at all. I can see where eating outside during the nice time of year would be really fun though. I ordered the pizza with goat cheese, fig, arugula, citrus and Parmesan. It was so amazing. I loved the way my taste buds danced as I learned the different flavors in each bite. The pizza was a little pricey for what you get $15. But I loved it. I would definitely come back.

4vjGQLw0SK65piHHig8sRw.text: On a recent visit to Phoenix we were headed down Scottsdale Road looking for a place to eat. We decided on Il Bosco. Fellow Yelpers never let me down and they were giving this place 5 stars so I decided we needed to try it ourselves.   We were greeted by Bill, (golf professional) and now owner of Il Bosco. Inside the restaurant is tiny but charming. The menu includes starters, salads and pizza but before ordering check out the "special board" that hangs from the ceiling. We finally decided on the Biagga. It came topped with prosciutto, fig jam and goat cheese. It was incredibly tasty and the perfect combination of ingredients.   What makes this place special is the personal touch of the staff and the quality of the food. They are there to make sure you have a good experience. After only one visit I'm hooked! Some of the best brick oven pizza I've had and I can't wait to go back!

O6rDzhI0MRh7gMMaulcWhQ.text: Saturday afternoon. Went in with a party of 5. Actually, you know what, I'm just going to cut to the chase. The entire party thought the service was surprisingly rude and the pizzas were all incredibly salty.  The dessert spumoni (why did we bother), was an over frozen artificial tasting chocolate covered block of ice cream.   Maybe a bad day for the business, but a terrible experience for me.

gf717fZhPACXarJ7pe2JDA.text: We are foodies from Portland Oregon. We saw a positive review so we gave this restaurant to try. It was excellent! We had a Caesar salad and a margarita pizza. They were delicious!

cOPfmsKEkvwvwtojx5NoLw.text: Open for lunch! My first time here I want with a group of girls from the office. Upon walking in the place is super cozy and welcoming. The owner greeted us right away. YB4qykOeK2mp7GMPCoLeAA.text: I was so disappointed. After drooling over these pictures and rave reviews for weeks  I finally drove the ten miles to get my fantasy pizza. Imagine my surprise when they handed me this tiny box weighing almost nothing. I actually asked the waitress if she gave me the right order. Funny, she asked me where i'd heard about the place and I told her the internet, she said "Yawp (sic) ?..yeah most of those are family or friends, we got 5 stars or somethin'." That explains ALOT! osQNZioRk1hHfMqv_XKkEA.text: Owner operated adding to a friendly environment and service.  A genuine establishment starting with quality ingredients and prepared with care right in front of you.  Delicious pizza!  I had and will definitely recommend the Biaggia pizza with prosciutto, fresh arugula, and a light sweetness from fig jam.  The Elana is very tasty as well with a nice savory and salty combo.  I look forward to returning and exploring more of the menu and specials.

OqzCY4X1bKSyGKWugpWSZg.text: We've been searching for a quality pizza place for a while, and this weekend, we found it in Il Bosco! The owner, Bill, waited our table himself and was so friendly, attentive and conversational. You can tell that he and the staff take a lot of pride in the quality of their food!   We elected to sit inside, which seemed to be the right choice, since the music next door was pretty loud and could have easily overwhelmed the outdoor seating area. The place was small, but quite cozy with a great view of the food preparation and pizza oven. Seriously, I watched that oven, and nothing sat in the window for more than a minute before it hit a table (impressive!!)   We started with some of the most tender, delicious meatballs I've had, sopping up the delicious marinara with our fresh, hot bread. Sooo good! We went for the Carmela pizza and both loved it!!! The ingredients were of very high, fresh quality, and it was piping hot! The wine was okay ($9 a glass is a little high for table wine in my opinion), but they kept our glasses full and we loved it! I hope to save some room for spumoni next time... Give this place a try! (They also offer take out if you're more interested in pick-up pizza!)

6UPxlMq_-w6Ri1jb08NwDQ.text: With a 4 1/2 star average on 155 reviews, there's little I can add that hasn't already been said.  It just feels good to add another 5 star vote for a pizza that is unusually good.  Standing out as much as this pizza stands out should mean something.  From every big city to every rural town, there is always a pizza place.  Our own USDA published a scholarly paper earlier this year calling pizza the world's most popular food.  On top of that, I've lived my entire life in Chicago, and notwithstanding the ridiculous notion some New Yorkers have that they know good pizza, most knowledgeable foodies agree that Chicago is the pizza capital of the universe.  And we do have terrific pizza in Chicago.  Lou Malnati's, Fox's, Toni's, Pequod's, Vito and Nick's, and on and on.  But there's something about Bill's pizza here that seems to always be served with a kind of pride and love and devotion to the product that is plain and simply rare.  The mozzarella is exquisitely fresh, and every single ingredient, from veggies to meat, is fresh and flavorful.  The tomato sauce rivals the best in Italy itself.  The crust is so good that it stands alone as a homemade bread of the finest ingredients.  And yes, I've had the famous Pizzeria Bianco, and Grimaldi's, and Oregano's, and they are all perfectly acceptable pies.  But Il Bosco is simply in a class by itself.  It's all done in a very small space, no reservations accepted, a little hard to see from the street - no matter, do whatever you have to do if you want one of the absolute best pizzas in a world full of pizzas.  I'm lucky, because when I visit Scottsdale several times a year to see my son and his family, he lives very nearby, and we can go at odd hours and avoid the crowds.  But whatever it takes, do it.  You'll see what I mean.

Yf0Ojf_CeR9Q_2Dq2mUN7g.text: This is my favorite pizza place in the area. It's a cute little restaurant where the owner actually cares to stop and have a conversation with you. I get take out from here often and the pizza is always fresh and never disappoints. Best place in the area!

yHlNwWJgzHHkO6ALOka8NA.text: Seasoned Phoenix/Scottsdale area diners know the usuals when it comes to great pizza: Bianco, Cibo, Pomo....Il Bosco deserves to join that list.   They serve pizza cooked in a wood-burning oven. Each pie (only one size here) spends about 90 seconds to two minutes in the oven. The result is fantastic. What separates great pizza from good? The crust. And the crust at Il Bosco is the right combination of the three Cs: char, crisp and chew that you can only achieve with an extremely hot pizza oven. If you judge your pizza on the crust, first and foremost, as I do, you'll love this place.  Of course, pizza is more than simply great crust. Pizza varieties, all named after women, should be enough to please everyone. Il Bosco offers a good variety of red and white pies. I didn't try any of the white pies yet, but they looked very good. I can heartily recommend the following red pies: Joanna, Elana and Lucia. Elana was my personal favorite, with mozzarella, olives and sopressata salami.   Beverages are somewhat limited, but that doesn't mean you'll be disappointed. Bottles of wine are affordable. The Italian Pinot Noir was excellent at $25 for the bottle. They also have two types of beer on tap, Four Peaks Kilt Lifter and an Italian brand I cannot recall. Soft drinks include cane-sweetened colas and root beers.  Dessert options were also limited, likely because the pizza is so good most don't have room for dessert. The creme brule was topped with fresh fruit (strawberries and blueberries). The flavor was quite good, but I felt like it should have had a thicker layer of burnt sugar.  The size of the restaurant adds to its charm. By my approximation, it seats no more than two dozen diners at one time. Bill, the owner, was working with just two employees Saturday night. At times the action became frenetic, but they worked with a smile, and were never too busy to engage in conversation. Despite the fact that there were people waiting to be seated, we never felt rushed.  Get here before the AZ Republic reviews this place. Because the line will be out the door once the word is out!

h4-uQBfWe7G0f8IC0WZxVg.text: So happy I found this gem. The wifey and I were in Scottsdale for approximately 2 seconds for work. We were starving, took to yelp and found Il Bosco. It's tucked away in an unassuming lot but the pizza is decadent to the max. Some of the best pizza I've ever had. The restaurant itself is small but the decor and outdoor patio are gorgeous.  Great service, GREAT food, I dream about the prosciutto, fig and goat cheese pizza.

4jtGIPhble3AS8ASdAoPUQ.text: What's not to like about this great little Pizzeria?  Tucked away next to Handlebar J's, this cozy place has all the charm you would expect from an owner that has a passion for creating an authentic Italian experience.  We have visited Il Bosco now on several occasions since its opening, and have yet to find a flaw in the service or food.    Having the owner personally wait on you is always a nice touch in a locally owned restaurant, and Bill makes sure that you always feel welcome and appreciated.    Il Bosco has an excellent wine list that compliments the eclectic selection of wood fired pies, including a refreshing Procecco that really hits the spot on a warm Arizona evening.  These guys even produce their own sparkling water!  Complimentary in-house marinated olives and artisan bread baked fresh daily make a nice start to the meal, while Il Bosco's version of Caprese salad will make you think you've died and gone to heaven.  The fresh, local ingredients Il Bosco uses makes all the difference, and has this starter bursting with flavor.  Chef Dennis is the "mastro pasticciere" at Il Bosco, turning out crispy/crunchy deliciousness from his 700+ degree wood-fired oven.  It is obvious this ain't his first rodeo, and is happy to explain his technique to anyone who is lucky enough to grab a front row seat at the bar to watch him in action.  The pizzas he serves up are nothing short of amazing.  The Biaggia - a goat cheese, fig and proscuitto really took me by surprise and has now become one of my favorites.    Last night I had the Domenica - a spicy sausage and leek pizza that redefined my opinion of what a sausage and leek pizza should be. :)  There are pizzas for the less adventurous, I encourage you to go to the Il Bosco website and take a look the menu, then call for a reservation to experience this outstanding Scottsdale treasure!     Support your local restaurants, folks!  They are what gives a city it's uniqueness.

tlGjosL237Ji073DU7hjFQ.text: WOW ...  some on Yelp feel  there is a controversy about the quality of pizza at Ill Bosco?  You have to be kidding me ...  I challenge anyone in a very loving way  to take a drive out to this very centrally located location (Shea and Scottsdale rd) and sit down and try one of the pies.
