XzmtN1kADuVy09UeqXc19A.text: I don't write Yelp reviews, but this place deserves it. Il Bosco is amazing. If you want authentic pizza, from a real non-chain family business, this place is it. Great place for a date, or to have dinner with family or friends. The service here is personal, authentic, and just enough. Your server will likely also be the proprietor. The pizza is stellar. Order meatballs for an appetizer. Order whatever is on special for the evening. This place is small and intimate, in good ways. Sit outside when it's nice out. Support small business, authentic pizza, and visit Il Bosco aka The Forest.

GcUFv9jsPFGaXHZXWNIBUA.text: The best pizza we've ever had. Incredible service...they make you feel very welcome. Beautiful patio. We'll be back again very soon!

fQ2FGpV5_BsNVg0ouhRtzg.text: We had a great meal and experience at this local family run business. If your staying in the Scottsdale area this should be on your list. Awesome homemade ingredients, friendly staff and an owner who takes great pride in his pizza. Well done!

Ge6lm--L3WytNLwEgwQNFw.text: Fail.  Walked in on a weeknight around 7 p.m. Tiny seating area all but full. One 4 top remaining. We asked to be seated there. A worker said that he'd rather we sit at the bar. Well, um, you have an open table and 2 people who want to sit and spend money here. No, I don't "do" bar seating to eat dinner. I'll sit at a bar if I want to knock back a drink or two, maybe have an app. and then take off. Sitting at a bar is not a comfortable way to relax over dinner and unwind after a long day.  So, no thank you. Despite awesome reviews that suggest the food is good. Attitude is important, too. There are ways to handle this kind of thing. And, there are ways to not handle this kind of thing.   Probably will not make another attempt to try this place. I don't need attitude at the end of my long day.  NOTE: To the person who decided to call me out - by name - over this review, this was my legit reaction to my experience. I'm glad you had a better experience. Clearly many reviewers find that this place offers amazing food. I wish I'd been treated well enough to have been able to discover this for myself. No need to call anyone out by name, sir. Our experiences are our experiences. The Yelp community can help one another by providing honest feedback.  Second update: I've been debating whether or not to write this for a while. First off, there wasn't just one, but two fellow Yelpers who chose to call me out by name for the above review. Not cool! Like it or not, it's a legit recap of my experience. And, I was able to get one of those people's reviews taken down. No idea why the other stays put. Whatever. Here's the reason for this update: five months after I posted this review, the owner reached out to me via private email. Props to him for that even if it came five months after the fact. However, in his explanation, which was, actually, not unreasonable, he decided to say that I had "stormed out." Well, sir, that isn't True. How is it that I made such a memorable impression if I was in and gone in under a minute and it was many months ago? You said to our request to sit at a 4-top and I quote, "I'd rather you sit at the bar." You didn't say something like, "I'm sorry but that table is reserved and we'll have another table in a few minutes." Had you said that, sir, we very likely would have stayed. Clearly your food is very good; I dine out a lot and I rely on Yelpers to give good advice. Congrats for the good reviews on your food quality. But, don't take an opportunity and turn it right back on me saying that I "stormed out" before you could explain. Just for future reference, because it is truly awesome you can fill your restaurant, and serious congrats for that, it's not your customer's fault that you are full up. A friendly, "we'll have an open table in just a bit" works. "I'd rather you sit at the bar" doesn't play well. Good luck.

HMLs_ZF6sxuPkScgsZIkrw.text: Love! Amazing quality of food, love the quaint ambiance and rustic decor, and the service is phenomenal! We will definitely be back! Perfect little spot for a date night! :) pizza was delish!

QDbrSWYbe_Ii5GCM8RJxGw.text: I love living in Arizona. Everything you need is within 10 minutes of each other. We were looking for a good pizza place and this little gem just might be it. It's cute and quaint and offers excellent wood fired pizza! It was cooked perfectly and had that delicious wood fired taste to it. Delicious home made pizza sauce as well.   The owner was incredibly kind and welcoming as well. He spent a lot of time talking to us and making lovely suggestions for us to explore our new city.  He really knows how to run a business and make his patrons feel comfortable.   I can't wait to come back.

zl_ob2wBr8jKfGsbqyk2Jw.text: My family and I have made this a regular in our local dining rotation and it is by far our favorite pizza in the valley. QUALITY ingredients, and the staff is always warm and friendly.

iRfJWwsN9s5munde6PApFw.text: This was our second time eating here, but it will definitely not be our last!  We had the pizza again, and it was excellent.  This place also has Italian beers and craft sodas.    It's a nice, welcoming divey place, where you really feel comfortable.  And the prices are very reasonable, especially for such premium wood-fired pizza.

rXxPXoPmkanwSsArOE6hpw.text: I'm new to the area, so I've been slowly trying local pizza places trying to find my new favourite pizza. This was the worst one so far. I ordered through DoorDash.com, which was a disaster unto itself. I can't blame Il Bosco for the fact that my pizza arrived cold. What I can blame them for though, is that the pizza was inedible because it tasted like a salt lick. My Order - The Adrianna (cheese, tomato sauce, basil) I have had some bad pizza in my day, but I can always power through, because even bad pizza is usually has some redeeming quality. This, however, I had to throw out. It was burnt in places (I know wood fire pizza is going to have some char marks, but this was flat out burnt). I would have been willing to deal with the burnt parts, but it was so salty I couldn't choke it down. Believe me, I like salt - I add it to everything. If I'm saying it was too salty, it's because it tasted like someone dropped the entire jar of Morton's in the sauce, then tried to hide the spill with the cheese. Perhaps dining in would yield a better pie, I don't know. It would take a lot of me to take the risk though.

JyKDXT2cohCw27snAVAAIQ.text: Going to this place was literally a last second decision. We were on our way to the movies and saw this online. This place is tucked away off of Scottsdale Rd and north of Shea. We split a pizza- 1/2 mushroom 1/2 plain. In addition we split a caesar salad and finished off with a lemon soybello. Everything was fabulous! Definitely will go back.

photos.caption: Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

bNI21d2Nm1uGvfsdcgiHNQ.text: From the super friendly owner to the excellent excellent EXCELLENT pizza I can't recommend this place enough.  It's my go-to restaurant when out of town friends visit and I want to impress. It's the restaurant my girlfriend will always say yes to. It's the place where I get the best olives around.  Just go, you've spent too long reading this. Go now and enjoy.

0aDZJea1FQNWKpFUfFwFyg.text: We love this place. I have been working on and off in Scottsdale for the past 5 years. I always try to find a night on each trip to take a pizza or two out for dinner. Friendly people, great wood fired pizza and always done to perfection!

wDaA04qFz7O_tXZRcXFX6w.text: Great food, check.  Convenient location, check.  Friendly local owner, check.  I had been referred to Il Bosco by a fellow yelper some weeks back... And finally decided to venture out for a casual lunch. So happy that I did.   The pizza here is wonderful-fresh ingredients in yummy combinations, straight from a woodfire oven. I tried two different pies, the Caprese salad and their creme brule.  All were well made and the service speedy and friendly.    The store front can be hard to spot (blink and you might miss it), but I actually like the "hole in the wall" feeling of a smaller local business. Take the time to seek this gem out!

photos.caption: Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Great pizza,  great ambiance, lovely owner. We even got a daily pie named after our baby!

0ewd2O4lvtkJeuvOuOx6QQ.text: This is a great neighborhood find. If you drive to fast, you would pass it. It's worth the stop in. Great wood fire pizza, salads, and service. Great decor and ambience. Very clean and well maintained restaurant. We will definitely be back in. Thank you !!

ZvhtjP0Tr5sgPDfDA-rK4g.text: The BEST olives, root beer, roasted vegetables, bread and pizza I have ever had!!! Better than Pizza Bianca by far!!! Addicted!  Jan. 21, 2015 - and I'm still addicted but I'm as thin as ever!! My wildest dreams come True!! A pizza that doesn't make you fat!!!

photos.caption: Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Spinach, mushrooms, and onion pizza
Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Roasted vegetables

JnM_2DJDzfFWsHNCcVp8Xg.text: Came here before going to the movies and we will definitely be back. The food and the service was top notch! Very happy we stumbled upon this gem.

Q92wjHEvYsb7Zi0XVljHQg.text: Amazing Pizza!  We ordered 8 pizza's and there was not a slice left.  Even the kids had great things to say.  The service was awesome.  When we are back in Scottsdale we will definitely be back!

JHWkN_yvR29S5y3oOCOdAg.text: Great pizza! Nice atmosphere. I like the Lucia - cheese, tomato sauce, sausage, and mushrooms. My wife likes the Biaggia - prosciutto, figs, four cheeses, and arugula. Not a ton of options on the menu but that's because what there is is enough :-)  Check it out if you're in the neighborhood.

hx98ZNiH-KV0Xkmb6nqgkQ.text: Recently moved from the East Coast. So glad Yelp introduced us to Il Bosco. I highly recommend the Biaggia pizza. It's amazing. Great food and great hospitality from this small little spot.

loTU1qqa7TgR_OoNcBQeQw.text: Phenomenal pizza, quaint atmosphere, fresh ingredients. There was 2 of us, we ordered the Lucia and the Dona and inhaled both of them ! I'm from Chicago, and I have finally found pizza that can be called pizza !! Delicious crust, very friendly staff, excellent service, and tasty complimentary olives while you wait for your pizza .... can't wait to go back !!

Nk6S0ggOg5w3-MqYlm2ODA.text: Read such good things.  What a disappointment. Really? Five stars?  Maybe for attitude!  Paying for "still" water is really a joke when you are spending $27.00 on a bottle of wine  plus the cost of two pizza's - you would think water would be free.  If we were you we'd try Fate Brewing just down the street for a great wood-fired pizza and all the FREE "still" water you can drink without attitude.  Sorry, we only wish it was better as it's just out our back door.  Best of luck to Bill.

mWPhmMeBQvtOa82raold8w.text: A great little intimate spot and the pizzas are wonderful. Afterwards, ask for their homemade amaretto - spectacular.

8HuAo81YMKMB7Tc8l-hGAw.text: Very good pizza in a small restaurant that also does catering.  The owner is a nice guy who really cares about service and the quality of his food.  We will definitely be returning.

vr5ZusHh6hhAuq4-zvHEcQ.text: If you have not been here it is a must try! The food is incredible and the owner is great. The restaurant itself is small and the outside is nothing fancy but once you try the food you will understand what is so special about this place!

SfB5k-ZWMbuBnm_fUjNfsg.text: The place is cozy and the owner is typically the server which is great.  Loved the varieties of pizza, amazing flavor from someone who knows how to make a great pie.

2eeZeDzYesB6WAYWpzsmVw.text: We ate there a few nights ago with our kids and it really was perfect. The atmosphere is charming, our server was fantastic, and the pizzas were exceptional!  Such a special and wonderful place. Hope to go every time we are in Scottsdale.

dRxCVlpvJFrJrFrGJmpk_g.text: The owner was our waiter and he was very nice. He even started the deep fryer so we could have fried ravioli even though it was lunchtime and they usually only serve that at dinner. The ravioli and pizza were excellent and prices reasonable.

g-XIMV6hBu12SsuPISfAYg.text: Visiting from California and Bill was the ultimate host and the food was excellent. Salads were fresh and awesome. Pizzas were crisp and inventive.  The wine was delicious and very reasonably priced (and served at the correct temperature to boot). It's a great little space in a city full of cookie-cutter restaurants, this is a unique gem.  I recommend it highly.

dFq1i5EoWOqct1T3i6aniA.text: We ordered takeout pizza from Il Bosco after reading the Yelp reviews. My pizza had a burnt bottom...like it was dusted in flour and then burned. It ruined the whole thing. The sausage was just fair. My husband's pizza was soggy and "wet" as he called it and he said it was one of the worst pizzas he has eaten. We so wanted to like this place--the patio and interior were charming. Still, food is what makes the rating for us and this hardly deserved even the 2 stars.

4Mpaai3LXow8M2gXq6BfhQ.text: Quickly becoming a favorite spot. Nice patio, great pizza! My favorite is the Gisella - pepperoni and jalapeno.

I4TIh2v_1oLDed-XELCMmg.text: Small and quaint...until we got there that is. This restaurant is tiny.  There are about five tables inside. Somehow that was enough for us because they weren't busy at 8pm on a Friday. There are only a few choices of pizzas that they offer. The choices are good ones though. There is amazing free bread while you wait that is warm and soft. The pizzas are big and more than enough for the average person. The desserts were very delicious as well. I know this is a small complaint but the sodas are disgusting. They don't have Pepsi or Coke products just these custom cane sugar drinks. No bueno. The owner talked with us half of the time we were there. He is a cool guy. Just don't ever ask him for ranch, ham or pineapple for your pizza. It offends him rightfully so because his pizzas are pretty good. The service was okay but the server rarely came around. We didn't get our check until 30 minutes after we were done.

ukwe0o75fOvYzqCaHsD6Ug.text: My wife and I love this place. The pizzas are cooked perfectly and topped with creative and very tasty toppings. Each one has a story.  Ask the owner. All of the staff are very friendly and helpful. Our new favorite place!

cEIi9oinJ_moaKloe3Y24Q.text: We're from Northern California, so finding good pizza is almost a mission for us. We drove 15 miles to find Il Bosco, and the food did not disappoint. The outdoor patio seating was a nice bonus. Do be aware that in Scottsdale, most restaurants button up tight at 9 pm, so be sure to allow enough time to order and eat before closing. We arrived at 8:15 and got a chilly reception. The person waiting on us splashed the wine into our glasses and I ended up with some on my jeans. Plates and dishes were removed without asking before we had finished eating. Since others on Yelp have praised the service, we're chalking up our experience to our poor timing.

2ojnJp0v2jGCXa6_QLUUgw.text: Came here based on the reviews and this place exceeded my expectation. The service was excellent; we took the suggestions of our server, who I think could be the owner. We shared three pizzas between the 4 of us and it was the perfect amount of food. The biaggia was our number one and is also a house favorite. Do not leave this place without a pour of the after dinner amaretto!

6ymHX2avz-GUa-2zGagTXg.text: . We were in Phoenix last week and decided to try this place based on all the great Yelp reviews. I'm glad to say we were not disappointed. The pizzas are absolutely amazing. The owner runs this place himself and takes great pride in making sure that you are fully satisfied. The next time that we are in the Phoenix area we are definitely going going to have to make a return visit if I could I would give this place 6 stars

6DWyQiM0TFc33zUsSTGFMw.text: I'm seriously wondering about all of the "5 star" rave reviews here. I went to il bosco last weekend with a couple of friends.  We sat at the bar right in front of the pizza oven.  The first thing I noticed was a giant bag of pre-shredded mozzarella cheese sitting on the counter. For an authentic Neopolitan-style brick oven pizza place that is unacceptable. As expected the pizza tasted like it was made with processed cheese.   The sauce and mozzarella just melted into a big gooey mess in the center and the crust was pretty dry and flavorless.  This pizza is average at best. I was really disappointed in this place, especially after some reviewers compared it to Bianco's, Cibo and Pomo.  Hate to say it, but il bosco isn't close to being in the same league as those places.  If I didn't know better I would suspect most of these reviews are the usual friends and family pump-up.

LpQULZSPtY-nV0AqWhkYgg.text: Awesomeness. Came from out of town and this place crushed it. Great service. Fantastic food. We'll be back for sure!

maP7b0Ez8PeGTmSz8MUfOQ.text: I've tried every pizza place in the area and this is By far the best place to get pizza in Scottsdale.  They use only the best ingredients on their pizza.  Also have excellent root beer.

X2g4DTGELsyV4jQlyGb1Dw.text: Words don't even begin to describe the love I have for this place!  The food is outstanding, as is the service.  I crave their pizza (and olives!) weekly and just wish I had the time to eat there more frequently!  Bill (the owner) is extremely kind and it's clear that he really wants his customers to be satisfied.  This is hands down the best pizza in town...yes, better than Pizzeria Bianco.  They've also catered a few events at my house and for my kid's school and done a great job!  Bryn DeFusco

V7HdW_W_1ZIbgD9qPUK93w.text: Love this place! It's dark, intimate and they do pizza really really well. The limited menu tells you how serious they are about getting the pizza right. The brick oven makes the crust so crispy and their toppings are always very fresh. If you're looking for a casual place to have great pizza...look no further!

SZ0YPZxjkaGvFX920ISOHg.text: Our new favorite place for pizza! Friendly staff, fresh ingredients and great service.

FZ23M7JH2Flpoz4inJ3i6w.text: Very solid pizza with great atmosphere!  Low key, friendly, and all about excellent pizza with fresh ingredients.  I knew as soon as I saw the brick oven and the simple wine glass that I was in the right place.  Just wish I found it sooner

WIgHwEdY52UHZSxg22ugxA.text: Wonderful wood fire crust and great 'guenuine' sausage slice from Guido's of Chicago (in Scottsdale)....that crust with the wood fire flavor...wow!!!

photos.caption: Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The Joanna pizza...real sausage....from Guido&#39;s

mtPiC_uM9uU-kJIidPkJlw.text: Excellent!  We joined friends for dinner Saturday night and thoroughly enjoyed our meal.  Atmosphere, aroma, dinner, service were top notch.  I'm so glad we were introduced to this awesome little restaurant. We will go back and bring more friends!  Thank you!

nPDJ6xMgwVUF1VhHmbeIIA.text: Can't say enough about my meal here. From start to finish it was a pleasant, enjoyable dining experience. Friendly, attentive service and delicious food. Three of us shared a bottle of wine, caprese salad, Biaggio and Carmela pizzas, and a taste of their homemade amaretto. Wonderful homemade crust and top notch toppings make Il Bosco a special place. They seem to do a brisk carry-out business, too. They also have a portable wood-fired oven to do catering. Wish I lived here so I could be a regular!

YH0J2B3b3pWomKYJg4XcEw.text: We happened to stumble upon Il Bosco by chance. The service was wonderful and the food delicious. The owner made sure we were taken care of and enjoying our meal as well as our server. Very helpful with recommendations. We had the Adrianna, Biaggia, Joanna and the special of the night. All were wonderful but the Biaggia seemed to be the table favorite! I've found my new pizza place.

59bX3enLovWosj-eGkY7zQ.text: Went here for my birthday and had a great time. Only negative was they ran out of bread and our server had obviously not been serving long. The pizza is by far the best in the state!

Er2LcSIkBa-594jF0-8Fpw.text: I took my family of seven to IL Bosco's last night and was I ever happy I did. Coming from the Pizza capital of America, Connecticut, this restaurant would be one of the best against the nationally ranked pizza places there. My wife had the Fig, Goat cheese, Prosciutto and Arugula pizza,what a pie. I had the Lucia, and the kids had normal pepperoni, which they all raved over. You also have to have the Caprese salad, very, very good. The service was very friendly and informative. My only regret on the restaurant is that it's here in Arizona and not Connecticut. Well done.

MwEpIfys0phO5nG80niZ_g.text: Who said that a great pizza has to be done with imported ingredients? California grown tomatoes, and local ingredients make this an amazing Italian style pizza. Checked by an a Italian born and raised in Italy now living in New York

photos.caption: Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

giq6ypCSAlFSAMJGMF31xg.text: The food and service are beyond exceptional! They had a nice selection of wine. I had a red that was delicious. The creme brule' with fruit was maybe the best I've had. I'm looking forward to going back soon.

WNhzW5Ce1t2Jeoh1RYbVLA.text: Stopped at Il Bosco after seeing a story about it on TV.  It was great!  We had a brunch pizza with chorizo, topped with an egg, then a pizza with sausage and spinach.  Both were really good!  We sat at the counter and watched the pizzas being made.  The cooks and hostess were all so nice.  It was a fun, unique, out of the way place--we will definitely stop in again on our next vacation!

9u-xl3z-_TYV5_ivmzkZ-g.text: Great pizza!! One of the best pizza places in AZ. Very convenient location near Scottsdale and Shea. So good!

fxWdJGO8DY4EkWCSlUvCtQ.text: Awesome pizza! We will definitely be back when we come back to Arizona. Being from North Dakota we don't have a ton of good restaurants so this place will be on our list for future visits! The owner was super nice and the patio seating was great. The crust on the pizza was perfectly toasted to perfection and it had some amazing sausage and Italian bacon!

Xy12V35cZ482CTFqCTxdaA.text: Had the pleasure of dining at il Bosco last night for my birthday and just wanted to share how great of an experience it was. The restaurant is small and does not seat many people so we were sure to make a reservation (they only offer 2 slots each night). At the last minute, we had to add 2 more to our party which they took on with no issue at all and were able to accommodate all of us. The food is awesome, the ambiance is great, quick and friendly service. All around, this was a very authentic Italian experience at what I consider to be a fair price point. The pizzas are intended to be personal size but if you're not starving, they could definitely be shared. For dessert we tried to vanilla gelato, spumoni tortufo, and a brownie. All of them were delicious but the spumoni was definitely the winner. At the end of our meal, the owner offered us all a taste of his homemade amaretto which was fabulous. Absolutely recommend this place for anyone looking to enjoy a good, affordable, authentic Italian experience.

JxA3YIIeOSY1nVFw0j0Gkw.text: Oh how I love pizza and this place was just great!  The space is cozy and really comfortable, the staff is amazing - we had the opportunity to talk to the super friendly and knowledgeable owner - and the pizza ranks up there as some of the best in Phoenix.  If you like hand crafted pizza, definitely check this place out!

cWm3EeBiJSQzi_bGNao6Ug.text: This wonderful hideaway has truly gourmet wood fired pizza, fresh salads and a very nice wine list.  The staff is attentive and personable. The owner takes an active and engaged role in the establishment. The bread and olive standard appetizer is a scrumptious treat!  The patio is beautiful at night (too sunny during the day) with a casual elegance perfect for an Arizona supper.

nUvegRc4bBPP6ng8WjhgFQ.text: Very small place a little difficult to find, but very good pizza, so far I think one of best pizza I had in Phoenix

Z7lZ_okXvLUEDAU8YjJc8Q.text: We have been here 4 times now and have never been disappointed. Small bar so we try to sit there. Great owner, a taste of homemade Amoretto for desert.  Pizza is awesome. We'll be back!

CSv2MzltMNOi9Y69i-Sc-w.text: We come here about once a week. Hands down my favorite place in the valley and the best pizza we've ever had. Bill is always there and gives the place a great feel-most of his family works there too-rarely have we found a place like this in the US.

FfBpMAvCiIw6VhtzIMbiLA.text: First time at this little hidden gem. Pizza was tasty and came out fast. Bread and balsamic is a great starter. The service was exceptional, our server was very knowledgeable and attentive!

iqidHYje7Gh9Dt81JLuM3w.text: Great food and even better service! If you are in the north Scottsdale area you definitely need to check this place out!

MZ6R7oFuPUESI4dafM2n6Q.text: Fantastic pizza spot.   I probably come here once a month when I'm up in the area.  Really nice owner and staff.  Usually sit at the bar and watch them fire up the pizzas.  Favorite pizza is the Carmela which has spinach, onions, and sausage.  Have tried many of their other pizzas as well and all have been delicious. Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The finished product.  Amazing pizza!
Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The Carmela just prior to going in the wood fired oven.

bv1J7TW-5x-UedhNstOfKQ.text: Great quality food with great personable service and a nice ambiance. What more do you want? The employees really were so friendly, we felt very welcomed. My husband got a sausage mushroom pizza and I got a cheese and basil one. One pizza could feed 2 people if you weren't extremely hungry. The pizzas were very fresh and seemed made from scratch. We also got a brownie ala mode for dessert. A bit pricey for the small portion ($7) but it was delicious.

nNRk0FQIYFwqbCGjOygTew.text: So so cute! I had no idea this place was tucked away here. There are so many good restaurants in this area, but this one I would've never even known about if it weren't for yelp. I came here tonight with my sister, and we both thought it was nice, the inside is a bit small and no one was sitting inside when we came! Outside we could hear the live music from next door which was fun haha. I loved the little lights. One complaint is it was too crammed..it was basically like sitting at the same table as the people next to us which was a little bit weird. Also we had to pick up and move the table to get in and out of our seats haha. But it didn't look like all of the tables were like that!  The bathroom was nice and clean which is a bonus. The lady who seated and served us was nice, everything done in a timely matter and she made sure to check up on us! My sister wasn't sure if she wanted the meatballs or a salad. She got the salad and wasn't a huge fan. It's a small portion for $7 and didn't even have caesar dressing, it had some other type of dressing. The croutons were weird too, I didn't like them. The bread with oil was tasty! And luckily, the pizza made up for the mediocre salad. Very good quality stuff! A tiny bit too soggy in the middle, but otherwise totally excellent. I'd love to come back and try out the pesto pizza! Would recommend this place too!

photos.caption: Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Adrianna
Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mm bread
Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Ix_-b-nuEDQEIUgvWgUAxg.text: Great hole in the wall type place with excellent service. Great 12" pizzas and salads. Loved the sausage, carmelized onions pizza.

8YqN9a9dCwvvpJuuZOcLXw.text: Simply the best pizza!  We have been frequenting this AMAZING find since relocating from Charleston, SC where we left behind our much beloved EVO.  Il Bosco never disappoints!  The service is warm, personable and top notch!  And the pizza !!!  We adore the caprese salad, any pizza on the menu and dessert here is a must... the warm brownie with ice cream is to die for!  Our southern hearts have found a new pizza haven in Il Bosco!

69duqPxrAkEc_Xojr-BKOg.text: My son and I discovered this little gem. Great pizza and burrata salad was awesome. Friendly atmosphere and courteous service. Highly recommend this restaurant.

mvHtOvi6HPkzzOfQiRB_Wg.text: Il Bosco is my favorite pizza place in the valley!  I have been to all the ones you know and all the ones that your friends tell you about with glowing eyes having just been to some great new hidden pizza place that they think they have just discovered. Let me know tell you, none of them compare.   It's a cosy place where you feel like family. The Canadian owner is super friendly as are all the servers. You are served some delicious olives which you can buy a jar of to take home. I prefer the Lucia pizza which normally has sausage and mushrooms but I get with pepperoni and mushrooms instead. The pizzas are all wood fired and when you take a bite you feel like you are in Naples instead of Scottsdale. My friend gets the Biaggia which is their prosciutto and argula pizza and if that is your thing this is where you want to come. It is so well balanced with the fig jam and earthy.   Go to Il Bosco! You will love it, scout's honor!

l5by-n5SanL7ggS-b7Cj6w.text: After scouring the United States to find the best pies, I would go on a limb to say that Il Bosco is within the Top 5 Pizzerias in the Nation! The sauce, the cheese, the quality of the toppings, and, most notably the crust, are all exactly what you'd expect from a proper thin crust pizza. If you live in the Phoenix area, don't eat pizza from any other restaurant until you get your butt to Scottsdale to try this place out. If you're visiting Phoenix from somewhere else, you need to try out this joint. It's truly a hidden gem.

_uKOby34N1WEHfqHhqLIsw.text: Yes! Yes! Yes! Pizza. Service and an authentically wonderful owner.   Why haven't you been here yet?

6u1YXgPXkOKoP8J-2uWpyg.text: We needed pizza, and we needed it now.  But not the kind of fast delivery or bake at home kind. No, we wanted GOOD PIZZA. And lo amd behold,  Il Bosco was a stunner. The place has a great patio area, though in the smaller side,  it had ample seating.  We ordered the meatball al forno and they came out quickly and piping hot.  Seriously amazing meatballs! Then the pizza came out not long after. The brick oven they had was the secret to making one of the best pizzas we've enjoyed in AZ. We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pizza was delicious!!

bXSx2DBUlw40eyZYKumgeg.text: As an Italian with high expectations in this area of food, I went into this restaurant with high expectations. In doing so I look for two primary concepts in a restaurant, the food itself and the environment. Bosco Pizza implemented both the food and environment excellently.  Environment: Once I walked into the restaurant I immediately felt welcomed. I was hit with the aroma of the Italian pizza as well as a welcoming environment from the owner himself named Bill. While the restaurant was completely full, he managed to get the five of us a table within five minutes. Once we received our table, Bill was incredibly friendly and the restaurant itself gave off a social vibe to it. I was incredibly impressed by the look of the interior design. It was small, yet filled with more than one would expect from an Italian restaurant. There were multiple unique decorations and the specials of the day labeled clearly near the kitchen. When we ordered the food, Bill was incredibly informative as well as clear of the kind of food we may want to order. We had a friend who was dairy free and he was clear on what she may enjoy as well.  Food: I was thoroughly impressed by the menu. There were a myriad of options and unique menu items. I order a pizza called the Biaggia. This masterpiece of a pizza consisted of prosciutto, fig jam, goat cheese, and arugala. At first bite my taste buds were hit with a plethora of flavors without being overwhelmed. While it was on the expensive side for the amount served, I was given a great return in flavor. If I was to give a complaint, it would be that I wish it was a larger serving. With this said, one should know coming in that Italian pizza is thin crusted and generally served for one or two people.  TL;DR With this said, I would highly encourage anyone to try II Bosco Pizza. This restaurant has combined both environment and the food itself for a masterful combo in order to provide the most excellent dining experience. I rarely give five stars, but this restaurant greatly exceeded my expectations. I will be returning soon.  (The pizzas are named after the owner's acquaintances)

k3wiIEIa5LJGx5UEOFq2iw.text: Phoenix is a pretty good pizza town, and this place is definitely in the middle of the pack. Nothing really bad about it, but not much stands out either. Honestly, I think my favorite bites were the complimentary starter olives.   My friend and I split an order of fried ravioli and a margherita pizza which was plenty of food, and our whole tab was only $20. The ravioli was fine, but again, nothing remarkable. I liked the pizza, but I felt adding a little red pepper and parm helped the flavor. At better places, I don't have to do that.  I wasn't particularly happy with our server because he was very condescending when I told him we needed our check right away because we were late for a movie. He said, "You know, no one in history has ever been late for a movie because they were eating at a restaurant." Then he proceeded taking his sweet time getting our check and making change. Prior to that exchange, he was much more pleasant.

oCf-6HRl7EyTqrY3-Fd79w.text: Just the best. Fantastic owners/chefs/staff.  Delicious, fresh & such an intimate little setting.  I'd recommend their pizza to anyone - it's SO good!!!

Kh8Wpf7uDzovSSTyNzG-sg.text: Charming place, the owner and Forrest is an great, very nice and so helpful made my husband , me and our 2 daughters feels so welcome and comfortable. He explained very well the menu, the special and told us they could make whatever we wanted that wasn't on the menu . It wasn't the place we chose to stop at first but were happy we did  . Will definitely come back again , not for the free bread and olive oil basket he gave us but for his welcoming and the charming atmosphere

photos.caption: Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

EAM1cvnp_r0losot5pFfug.text: The best gourmet pizza in the valley.  Forget all the other wannabes. Creative apps, salads and pizzas. Ambiance is fantastic. My wife and I come her all the time and are True foodies.  You won't want to go anywhere else after eating pizza here.

cA7bygVhgGmpsa5VmHg0rw.text: This is so good. All good pizza and every thing on the menu is meant to be there. Great hipster soda and great service. Go here!

pVMUhBIIe-Aztv9wXsjNQg.text: Been waiting to try this place for a while to feed my pizza addiction. I take it this spot depends on word of mouth because you would never know it was there unless you went to Handlebar-J's or paid attention while you hit Jack in the Box at 1am. Anyway wood fired pizza that is excellent, lots of nice combinations, we had the special called "Juania" that had spicy sausage, caramelized onions, and Jalapeno. Nice little wine list that had some Italian classics, very affordable bottles no more than $40. Overall a great spot to kickback and have a few bottles and pies. I have to say lastly that the quality of everything was great, extremely fresh and creative combinations on the pizza and apps for example the Caprese salad came with Burratta cheese as well which is something I haven't come across.

UBCZTN9T_Mm3O8UvD4D6jw.text: What a great local pizza place!  Neat outside atmosphere and the kale salad and pizza was delish!

IvOp8dhA2hG5YjPUMkSDoQ.text: Super food and great service.  Really like the patio, and try the Salsa de Parmigiana.

7ww5Ee9LwL5BSrxOeMJ-NA.text: A great find in Scottsdale. Delicious pizza, friendly service, what a gem! Had to buy an extra pizza to take home.

_e9MAjKoxqGQA8GHLHjYdg.text: came here a few weeks ago and the pizza is STUPID GOOD!!! :-)  its been a few weeks so i forgot the name of the pizza but it wasnt on the menu, it was written on the board, a daily or weekly special? it has peppadew peppers and i hope they have it as a special a lot or add it to the everyday menu. cant wait to go back  oh yeah, almost forgot about the olive oil. amazing !

QXJARBiMx6MCP9adnSpUdg.text: Great little pizza place. No picture because we ate it all. Ate it fast sooo good. And also roasted vegetables were wonderful.

Lndz2_mM3xReVYlxQhNRUQ.text: Finally!!! I found pizza in Arizona. This is the best I have ever had. All ingredients are fresh. The crust must be some family secret because I know my dough and Bosco's is amazing. Thank you for paying such great attention to every detail. I noticed. XO M

fW76LaPHA8YBuF4uW13uNw.text: What a great experience. Everything here is 5 star. The food the service the ambiance. Not much missed. Went in super hungry left super happy. The food.... oh the food we had caprese which the pesto may have been the best I've ever had. We had the stuffed peppers sweet And savory. It tastes like made with love and from scratch. The pizza we had the Joanna... pepperoni, sausage i added some Fixins. Sauce was amazing. I have already told 5 people and i hope i get to tell more. Nothing better than value and experience. I look forward to being a regular here. Top knotch

2Zn_MdVmNUkvg6jRkhS2Eg.text: All I can say is....AMAZING! The pizza is fabulous, the service is phenomenal and great drinks. My kids loved it and they are picky eaters. I would highly recommend and look forward to going back soon.

izP7711iFkVU51pNUqyXRw.text: I have been in Italy many times and have had good pizza. I think Il Bosco is Scottsdale is as close or even better! I loved it!!! The appetizers are very delicious as well. And they have great wine selection! My favorite pizza spot!

UrZmAnMqFlhbhtx1Hi1PyQ.text: Best pizza in Arizona!   Lovely little spot for a date night or bringing the entire family.

mdvnXXnfz9IpZM9jvhlGZg.text: This is our neighborhood restaurant, with a great location and great atmosphere.  We especially love the outside patio area.  They grow their fresh herbs right outside on the patio.  We've been coming here since day one, and it just gets better and better! Tonight we had the caprese salad which was amazing as was the handmade wood fired pizza. We topped the night off with the Creme Brulee with fresh strawberries.  Everything was so delicious!! This place is perfect for any occasion. Dinner for two or something larger. In the past, we've held my daughters sweet 16 party as well as my 50th bday surprise party.  This is a place you can always count on.  Thank you Bill!!!

photos.caption: Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Beautiful night to sit outside.  Great atmosphere!  Owner is so wonderful. He comes around to every table.
Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

vt7LzxSj-c3MtC7PyUoBFw.text: Yum! We had the Peppadew Peppers stuffed with Italian sausage and the Biaggia pizza (prosciutto, fig jam, four cheeses, arugula). They were both perfect. I especially loved the pizza crust, it was exceptional - slightly thicker and chewier than most wood fired pizzas which I really appreciated. The service was so wonderful too. I wish we lived in the area so we could be regulars (there were several friendly regulars dining tonight which is always a sign of a great restaurant with exceptional service), and we'll definitely come back if we're in town again!

DVVzUBbTNAg5fCwnBP-ydA.text: This one of the best pizza dining experiences I've had in the short 2 years of living here!  The 'brothers' couldn't have been more cordial and welcoming!  Chris definitely knows what he's doing with a 700 degree wood fired oven. The pizza was absolutely the BEST!  I'll be back very soon. Much success Bosco family. Thank you!

OzV-ezbyPBNKQ23_CWT-Jg.text: I live in Chicago. I've visited Rome. I don't dream about places like I do Il Bosco. I'm not a chit-chatty person, but I always find myself wanting to talk to the owner. Everyone that works here makes the experience impeccable. You really can't go wrong with any pizza here, my favorite is probably the Carmela. Also, if you ask the owner he'll make this salsa cheese dip (pictured in my photos. Please go out of your way and ask, he makes it and is never annoyed with the request. This is hands down the best place in all of Phoenix/Scottsdale for pizza and I feel strongly about that statement.

photos.caption: Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

4mxWMwySbVJWahFFpv0EcA.text: David P.   You're sub part review is nonsense.  The owner is the most hospitable owner we have ever encountered !   Just a great environment and friendly people.  We chose to sit at bar and watch all the pizzas being made in the brick oven.  It made us change our mind 4 times in which one to choose!!   We had the special app of stuffed peppers and the spinach & kale ceased salad. Both amazing!  And then the owner asked us to taste the salsa di parmigiana with his homemade crostini, compliments of the house. Wow!!  Now my wife and I are enjoying and Italian beer and Italian wine, both great, while we decide what pizza to order.   We frequent the foodie town of Austin often and this place would kill there !!

5896QPsPOnd7ExiHomJCEg.text: Family operated and excellent service, Il Bosco serves up some excellent pies! Imports a ton of items from Italy. We love this place!

jNynm8pyAOudxxeXZXyfPQ.text: Last night of a 4 night stay and had a wonderful wood fired pizza and salad. The pizza was great for those that love a thin crust fired pie. If you want a Neapolitan style pizza you will not be disappointed. The staff was engaging and pleasant a good choice for a just right for the money meal. I will return when I come back to Scottsdale area.

_mnQQMRYb6ktHllaVhEGKw.text: Listen guys. I got a pizza from this place. The fungi. It was picked up by my wife and got to me about an hour later. Still one of the best pizzas i've ever had. It was unbelievable and they definitely don't skimp on the toppings. I have no problem going out of my way to eat here. It's totally worth it. If every pizza I get here from now on is 80% as good as the one I had I will be eating here forever.

8zkEzzxfdFq4iS4aCSykMw.text: This place is the bomb. Wood fired pizza...we had spicy sausage and peppers (the day's special). Get a red root beer too, a new staple for us.

_fp4f5fHQvuRBmdgkzsTog.text: Can't miss this place. Caprese was to die for. Pizza made in mugnani oven wood fired and you can tell. Crust was perfect. Sauce was also perfect. Best pizza I have had in a long time.

QDWtgJUqheKlsUamPbWkWA.text: Great decor, bright and open.  Wood fire pizza oven is right in front of you.  Ingredients are high quality and the owner Bill is a really great guy.  The prosciutto, fig and goat cheese pizza was amazing.  Also, the housemade burrata was incredible.  They just installed a herb garden out on the patio.    I used to frequent this place when it was a previous business and owner.  It is completely flipped the mood of the environment and is a great new addition to the neighborhood.  We plan to frequent and often.    Don't ask if they are going to be open to the wee hours as in the past businesses.  It's not gonna happen.  Nice.

1vlW_hC0HQ5rx8tpML1w5g.text: Great wood fired pizza. Appropriately chilled wine. Fresh organic ingredients. Delightful conversation with the owner.

ySSWC4MO6aV2DbzLDtKHjw.text: First time customer and will be back. Good Caesar salad and 2 delicious pizzas. Met the owner (very kind) and they placed the pizzas in the oven so they were hot after baking for 2 minutes. Tasteful and they have a family that will return.

5_aLQeP3I9-6Kurx4hRzaw.text: Make sure you make your way here! Great service, incredible food, and very Mom & Pop feel. The meatball appetizer was delicious, and can't go wrong with any of the pizzas here. I would definitely come back here, and soon!

Thn5zF8k1urVuDLC6wkMEQ.text: We got a Joanna pizza to go. Pizza was good. One pizza fed two adults. They are about the size of maybe a medium. Atmosphere inside was nice. I will be back.

VRHiiNHiS3uKZYsMbwhHTw.text: Pizza  is amazing! Elana Pizza is the perfect balance of sweet savory and salt. Definitely a must try. Meatballs are better than my Nona's and best I've had. Menu is compact but everything is excellent!!!

C9BcQk9EHV8PNmcGePvTaQ.text: We've been in search of great pizza with no "attitude" since coming to Scottsdale seven years ago and Il Bosco has been added to our great list.  We ate at Il Bosco last night and had a lovely evening.  The outside patio area is very cozy and quaint.  Service was outstanding (Pomo could really take lessons from the Il Bosco servers).  We ordered a Caesar salad to share which the server (who I think may have been the owner) happily offered to split.  Our pizza choice was the Dona which was delicious with melty cheese, perfectly seasoned red sauce, salty pancetta and sliced Roma tomatoes.  Before dinner teasers of delicious olives and fresh sourdough bread with a fruity yummy olive oil to dip in were an excellent appetite opener.  The after dinner homemade amaretto was a perfect ender. During our visit we noticed several take out customers leaving with not just one or two boxes of pizza but three, four and five boxes.  We knew we had arrived at the right place to satisfy our pizza cravings.  Thanks Il Bosco for a great experience.

AbIQLqt7DCMna4U9r22-bg.text: Excellent food, great service.  Authentic Neapolitan style pizza.  You can hear the live music from The Handlebar next door - if you're OK with Country/Western while eating Italian food, that is.  Not the very best old world style pizza "I've" ever had, but it's pretty good - and very good for Scottsdale, which can get a bit tourist-centric.  Very good.

UyhGGq5Ul-Vtdkuye9iEbw.text: Delicious! I had a personal cheese pizza for lunch today and I loved every bite of it. The atmosphere is super cool. I loved sitting outside. The staff was very nice. It's a little far for me so I probably won't make it back again but if I did I would try to come for dinner. I bet Il Bosco is even prettier at night. Highly recommend!

MBRx68_jh_0HcWwSfgW9vQ.text: I have always had a great experience at this understated restaurant. The first time I ate here I ordered pellegrino and I was impressed that they make their own sparkling water. This set the stage for everything being made from scratch with fresh ingredients. The gentleman who I presume to be the owner, wearing a plain white t-shirt, and the staff were all very welcoming and non pretentious. The appetizers (meatballs and veggies) and pizza (Adriana + a few extra toppings), were excellent. I have been here both on dates and with my kids (ages 5 and 7) who like to sit at the bar and watch the pizza cooking in the pit. There is a small TV that sits in the corner by the bar which is convenient if you want to see the score of a game, and much more appropriate than an obnoxious big screen on the wall.

aoZG2o1qt1dk6PHfDjiZ6g.text: I appreciate when I have been to a place and  they # 1 remember my name, #2 thank me for my business and #3 give me the same excellent product every single time I come in. As I told them, my daughter may rip into the box the second I picked her up, 30 minutes away and she did! I called her and said I had a surprise! She got in the car, saw a science experiment kit...long face.then her nose ever so slightly caught a quaffed of what? what? " Is that Il Bosco?!!!" in the highest pitch thrill. "Pull  over! Pull Over!!" I said, " Roll down your window" in my best Corleone voice,"Pizza Delivery is yours"..so as we sat along Osborn and devoured pizza, her inside, me out. A sense of complete sublime bliss was the picture I foretold. As I said before, I am not a pizza girl, but there is something about the encumbrance of Il Bosco pizza that I needed tonight. They had no idea that I would be sitting and watching and weeping to a cancer benefit on TV, because of family and friends and Taylor and Ronan. Yet I picked their pizza to comfort me. The Biaggati)?) Salty and Sweet and different  and wonderfully complex yet  simple in crust. l  know this was without doubt the exact comfort I needed and will yearn for  because of all of  the above mentioned reasons.  It heats up perfectly at home, and although you may not have the same charm as being at Il Bosco in person, you have the same love ensconsed in their box of pizza pie.

photos.caption: Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of IL Bosco Pizza - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Best Pizza Boxes Ever! Sturdy &amp; a nice design so I save for organizing small items in my pantry. I see them &amp; the crave begins..

a-aP_l6P4_uiKzu8YLKN7A.text: Great pizza. Device was friendly and polite. Very patient with my kids had 1 million questions. We will definitely be back

9SKM-G9tJUHtADCCZyxfrw.text: Such a fun little hole in the wall! We're from out of town and found this place on yelp. We were expecting something hoity-toity but it wasn't pretentious at all. The pizza was amazing and a surprisingly affordable lunch option. So fresh and you get your pizza in less than 10 minutes after ordering. Great little unique place and the owner was very friendly and made us feel right at home!

dsPyk7url2vsqWWdjD6KmQ.text: Watch out Pizzeria Bianco, this place is just as good without all the hastle. My wife and I shared a salad (don't remember the name but it had lots of steak in it) and a Lucia pizza for lunch. Wood fired pizza was perfect and the salad was huge. Can't beat the bread which is actually made from the pizza dough. Service was excellent. It's a small place but they do have outdoor seating. Give it a try, you will be happy

bxTd-w1EMTtXufnaNpGUsQ.text: Very Good fresh wood fired pizza. We came here for lunch and had a sausage, mushroom, cheese and fresh basil, red sauce pizza. It was baked in a wood fired oven and it was absolutely delicious, served piping hot, right from the oven. The owner goes out of his way to make it right, using fresh ingredients and keeping it simple. We had a root beer and a cola soda from a very old company in NY. Again, the owner brings in this product because he thinks it's the best. Inside and outside seating. It's a nice place & maybe a little hard to fine, but it's worth a little effort. The finished product is well worth it. Give them a try.

7IxaGrecibdfwbAPOdSRxA.text: Great hidden treasure.  Go there now, it wont be long before the entire valley finds out about this place.    I LOVE the essence of this place.  This is exactly what we need as a developing restaurant city.  Charming, high quality products and OWNER occupied (Refreshing).  From the moment you walk through the door, you know this place is different.  Rustic Charm.....  This owner backs it up with great personal service and a high quality pie.  NOTE TO OWNER - RAISE YOUR PRICES!!!  Yes, $12 was the most expensive on menu....  I thought it would 7 inches....  Great value but I felt guilty.    Try this spot out.  I hear they are opening for lunch in October!!!

RkEy59E6E7ymen7BsFn2ew.text: Great service, great spot and great pizza. Fresh ingredients, the real deal oven, the professional service. I went for lunch, but will definitely come back for dinner.

OvCmrtKBpKCi6ejdzXdLcQ.text: This place has a lot of things going for it - it is just off the beaten path so that you can sit on the charming patio and it feels quiet and hidden.  And....they get the most important component of pizza right - the crust.  It's chewy and flavorful at the edges and thin in the middle while still standing up to the toppings and not getting floppy.  My only complaint is that they don't have a margherita pizza on the menu.  In my opinion, the margherita pizza is the True measure of a neopolitan style pizza restaurant, but Il Bosco does not offer one.  Their most simple pizza is this Adrianna, but instead of being dotted delicately with Buffalo mozzarella, it's spread liberally, American-style, with melted cheese.

-LEdl0fcu9_D0ZjgCKXCfQ.text: Very good italian style pizza. Visited this evening and got free olives and bread as a starter. They have a nice outside seating area in a quiet side street. The service was very good and the staff friendly and helpful.

mXoVj086hySguGRLE7JHwg.text: One of my favorite restaurants. Always get their Mia wood fired pizza. The owner Bill is one of the nicest a guys you'll ever meet. This is a MUST visit if you are in town.

lxSju6wQtfc4vtlX0Fmy8A.text: This is a bold statement you can only make once in your life, but this is best pizza I've ever had.  Eaten there twice in 4 days. You taste the freshness of ingredients with every bite & dough is so fresh it doesn't stay in stomach making you feel gross & like you have pizza hangover. Also try the meatballs - exceptional. Owner is cool guy trying to take a swing at his passion - have to respect an entrepreneur following his passion.

QdHAdFdTABRu0K0ZJBNQ_Q.text: This place is always fantastic and there is always something unique available to try on a regular basis (the daily pizza white/red specials are always fantastic!)  That said, this truly is a special place beyond the amazing pizza (and bread and olives and wine and....) and it's a result of the special attention that the proprietor Bill Forest gives to each and every customer that has the privilege of dining here.   My fiance and I try to go 2-3 times a month or more (we'd go 2x a week if we lived closer) and we're never ever disappointed, in fact, there is no other pizza that we will even eat now that we've found il Bosco.   Always fantastic, always personal, always amazing, I cannot recommend this place enough and implore anyone who's interested in pizza to visit here.

nALyAQEdfg6G0QuXVIGzaQ.text: The pizza is cheap (price) for the quality given. I've had 3 pizzas from here and they were all fairly decent, but their Biaggia pizza is the best by far. The prosciutto layer covering the entire top of it would cost a quarter of the price they ask for it, and the flavors go amazingly well together. The light sweetness of the figs balances the saltiness of the prosciutto, and the olive oil, parmesan, and arugula finish the visual appeal and further melds the flavors together. Incredibly savory all together. Unfortunately, I couldn't really taste any of the goat cheese, and the prosciutto make the pizza difficult to eat without a sharp pair of teeth.   The only cons are $3 for a bottle of water (premium filtered) with no option for free tap water . The lower than expected cost of the pizza evens it out though. That and I ever got to try their bread, don't know why some people got it and I didn't, but maybe it's because we didn't order an appetizer? (confirmed with the owner, the bread is complimentary but is usually served with a starter because they don't think serving bread with more bread (the pizza) really makes sense) The free olives were nice and tasty.

31z00R5_h2KdlR7F53yDNw.text: Wonderful wood fired pizza. The Cremini mushrooms are wonderful on the sausage pizza. This little hole in the wall pizza joint is worth searching for, just east of Handlebar J's.  They even have a portable wood fire pizza oven for catering.

0W04SMUqtrEYVujvUGet0w.text: Yup. It's all True. Great food, super charming place, very intimate.   We sat outside on the patio under a heat lamp. Enjoyed the olives as a starter, as well as some fried raviolis (yes, please) and a caprese salad app.  Outstanding artisan pizza, with as good a crust as I've ever had, and homemade mozzarella. Wine was just ok, but very reasonable. Server was attentive, helpful and friendly. Owner came by a couple times to check in on us and was absolutely delightful.   Deduct a point for the proximity to the Handlebar J Saloon and the faux-cowboys arriving in limos with 10-gallon hats. Then add a point back for the near-fight we got to watch between a biker and the faux-cowboy who almost hit him with his Cadillac.  We'll be back, and with more friends.

-7Xndrb5lmHLVgPs7NzjlQ.text: I am a Chicago born and raised pizza lover . I have had many Brick Oven pizza's. Found most to be ok. I am in the valley for several weeks. I decided to give II Bosco Pizza a try. It's location was easy to find and it is a small and inviting. I walked in and was greeted by the owner and I took a seat at the counter which gives you a great view of the Kitchen.I ordered a Caprese Salad and the Biaggia Pizza.  The Menu is small but easy to navigate. My server was friendly and from Chicago as well. The salad came and it was like no other caprese salad I have had including Italy. Fresh Mozzarella along with Barrata Mozzarella which has a creamy center topped with airloom tomatoes dizzled Balsamic and a light touch of pesto. it was served with olives cured in house with several slices of in house made bread. I watched my Pizza being made and it was timed perfectly to arrive just as I finished my salad. The Biaggia Pizza might sound odd but it will be the most AMAZING experience you will have in your pizza eating experience. The dough has a slight wheat taste that compliments the fig jam which is lightly spread on the dough, then goat cheese is added baked to perfection. the pizza is cut and topped with prosciutto slices  on each piece and topped with arugula and evo dizzled on top and some custom house mixture of grated cheese.   You must try this  6 Star Pizza Restaurant. You will not be disappointed by the Food, Service, and Price. It is a valley hidden treasure.

2nG12fpQU3Dfn5T_8SRFpA.text: SIRI found Il Bosco for us last summer when we asked for pizza on our way home from Kierland.  There are many good pizza spots near our home, but we are always hoping for something more artisanal.  This small, almost hidden wood-fired  pizzaria was the find of the year for us.  We have brought family and friends many times and have never been disappointed. When our company needed to find a caterer for a two hour event for 100 guests at the Phoenix Children's Museum I did not immediately think of Il Bosco.  The event was to be akin to a happy hour with wine/beer/soda/appetizers.  I really didn't want anything to do with the planning or execution of the event - I am not good at such things and I don't enjoy the process.  It wasn't until after seeing quite a few other options that I raised my voice.  The Phoenix Children's Museum is a wonderfully playful and unique setting and I felt we needed a more comfort oriented option. I remembered the pizza oven on wheels that sits in front of Il Bosco and asked my assistant to call the restaurant to see if Il Bosco offered event catering. We promptly received a catering menu with set prices based on number of guests.  We liked what we saw immediately.  A few days later, I met the planning team at the restaurant for lunch where we were offered samples of 5 or 6 pizzas that could be made on-site at our event.  It was a hit.  We selected a salad option, drinks and desserts. We received a VERY reasonable quote via email immediately.  Bill Forrest, the owner, went personally to the museum to meet with our team and museum staff to coordinate the set up and execution.  Bill offered suggestions without being intrusive and in every way demonstrated a willingness to "make it work." The event came off without a hitch.  The food flowed at a perfect pace - it takes just a minute or two to cook a pizza in that 800 degree oven.  Pizzas were consistently hot and in keeping with demand.  The salad and desserts were top notch.  Everything was perfect.  The sight of a wood-fired pizza oven at the event raised a few eyebrows and added to the anticipation of the evening. The absolute crowning contribution of Il Bosco to the evening was their having the forethought to bring pizza boxes and offering our guests fresh pizzas to take home.  It was a very nice and unusual courtesy as many of our guests had children at home. Il Bosco made us look good.  Our choice of a wood-fired pizza caterer made our event stand out.  Their professional appearance and behavior were exactly what we would have expected.  Il Bosco shines not only as a restaurant, but as a caterer.  Most highly recommended.

LervHoBAwpCOE1jOmUAlvg.text: Okay, I'm from NY.  This place is mere blocks from my house, and I've never been there before.  That will shortly be rectified.  Simply put, the best pizza I've had in Scottsdale.  Or in Phoenix.  Or in Arizona.  Hell, the best I've had west of the Poconos (I'd say west of the Hudson River, but there are some REALLY good pizza joints in Jersey).  Can't wait to try their Pananis.  I just keep saying to myself WHY haven't I known of this place before.   All that lost time.  Sigh.

nLyuqVmr6rg7FH68naYw9g.text: YUMMY!!!  My husband and I had a delicious lunch today on the patio.  We shared a salad and 2 pizzas.  The owner Bill had us try this pizza that was AMAZING!  The salad was yummy too :)    We will definitely be coming back again!  A hidden gem right off of Scottsdale Rd and Shea  LOVED THIS PLACE!!!

zQ-DUkJtG8Vk8KQMXvhPcw.text: The best hidden gem in Arizona. This place doesn't just have the atmosphere that you want for a nice lunch, or romantic dinner, it has the artisan hands-on quality you would expect from the best pizze in Italy.    They give you a plate of in-house marinated kalamata olives that are just to die for. I could eat just the olives all day. They also give you fresh baked bread with the best olive oil you've ever had. At this point in the meal, I was already thinking about my next trip back.   Both the antipasti, packed with flavor and excitement. The meatballs, in an excellent marinara, just perfectly cooked and seasoned. Roasted veggies with burrata, equally as great. The burrata was fresh, light, creamy, and tart; paired perfect with roasted beets. We also tried the special, peppadew peppers stuffed with Italian sausage; one bite of intense flavors perfectly combined. I'd try any special they offered, and I will for future visits.  The wood fired pizze? Amazing, to say the least. We had the Elana, sopressata, olives, amazing tomato sauce, and fresh hand formed mozzarella. I will be back to try every single one on the menu.   I have nothing bad to say about this place what so ever. The owner, who served us, is friendly and very accommodating. They have something very special going on here. They have made a regular out of me.  Update: Went back again today, yes two days later. This is the kind of place where you find yourself saying, "Yeah maybe I don't like anti-pasti because I've had it before and it wasn't very good", but you order it here, and it becomes the best thing you have ever had. I suggest, if it's something you wouldn't normally order, order it here, because it may just become the best thing you've ever had.

4e9t0qb55QVBCA60Mi9lZw.text: Love this place! Amazing wood fired pizza at an affordable price. We've eaten in the restaurant 4-times and have always had great service. We also order out and they wait for you to get there to fire up the pizzas. It's a must try!!

l9l9H9huWrb-sFPX4xwPzQ.text: Friendly staff.  Great casual yet intimate atmosphere. Get there early! It's a small place and fills up fast.  Very accommodating to get you a table as soon as possible.  So great to find a Super T glass of wine.  Love the house made sparkling water.  Meatballs were flavorful and hearty.  Pizza had yummy fresh ingredients and sauce was perfect.  Next time I'm getting dessert!

IsnWz8o-yrYjwIEJACBb5Q.text: romantic atmosphere, all the food was perfectly handmade and rustic.

39kmxtCDtSh4E-GxfsW3nA.text: Went here the other day for lunch and it was excellent. Both I and my friend had different pizzas at lunch and we were both very impressed. I'll definitely be back to try out the rest of the menu. The service was very good as well.  The only negative to the place is the seating is very cramped and it's pretty small in general. Not a huge fan of almost knocking elbows with the people at the tables next to me.  The food and service are outstanding and make up for it however.

feB4i2URGDfIFiawm6RyQA.text: Had been trying to get to Il Bosco for quite some time and after eating there last night, I have found I've been missing out.  Tucked in a tiny recessed space directly next door to Handlebar Js (one block north of Shea, just west of Scottsdale Road), Il Bosco is a rare spot here in the Valley - looks and feels much more suited for San Francisco's North Beach or Boston's West End - a quaint, neighborhood feel, a comfortable little space that doesn't try to make you feel like you're in Sicily but rather  is just is what it is - a gourmet wood-fired pizza restaurant that does what they do VERY well.  Not many places here in AZ where the owner greets you at the door and also serves as your waiter.  He also knows his pizza inside and out and took the time to chat with us about the process he uses to make his dough, the fresh baked bread, the construction of his pizza oven and his fresh herb garden out on the patio.  Il Bosco is clearly a labor of love for owner Bill Forrest. He did the entire build-out himself and says its easy to recommend pizza for his customers - "it's my menu...they are all my favorites or they wouldn't be on there."  From the caprese salad's crisp cherry tomatoes, creamy mozzarella and basil grown right there on the property to the two pizzas we sampled (one a standard red sauce, sausage and mushroom; the other at Forrest's recommendation - and something I would have NEVER ordered - was AMAZING...prosciutto, figs,white pizza...insanely good) - the entire experience was PERFECT.  This is a small neighborhood spot with an owner and a dedicated staff trying to make a go with great food and service to match.  This is the kind of place - and the kind of business owners - we want and need in our neighborhood!  Go - and go again. This place is truly AWESOME.

dD_cRlFdFWxNksPTMF8Nzw.text: As close as it gets to a real Italian pizza here in Phoenix. I am an Italian and I have only been here for a few years, and let me tell you, it is refreshing to finally get a taste of home. The crust is just the consistency that it should be. It's not an American pizza, it's much lighter and not as greasy. I will most definitely return on a regular basis.

J-bj6U2PG9x7NLu12btEHA.text: Small and un-assuming.  The pizza is excellent if you like real Italian thin crust done in a real wood burning oven.  Slightly burnt crust, fluffy edge and chewy. Service is prompt and friendly. My wife and I shared one salad, which we thought was little small, however the lettuce was cold and didn't come out of a bag like many restaurants. They make their own sparkling water which came in a very cold bottle - a nice touch.  Wine selection is small, but reasonably priced. The patio is small, so get there early if you want to sit outside.  We will definitely go back!

B9WbB9ke5LTzrzGaLJi_VA.text: My wife and I revisited this place after hearing from multiple people it was of the two best pizza places in the greater Phoenix area. To start, the vibe is great. Very small, tucked away Italian shop where you quickly get the feel that you have known the owner/waiters for months already. Needless to say, the service is great. The owner came by on both our visits and chatted with us about whatever it was we wanted to talk about - this time, restaurant reviews :) Now we ordered a Cesar Salad to share, 3 pizzas between 4 of us (we had guests) and a cookie dessert. The salad was delicious. Very light dressing with farm to table greens. It isn't your typical Cesar though, much more airy. The portion size is on the smaller end. The pizzas are incredible. We tried the classic margarita, Lucia and fig spread one (can't remember the name but definitely their signature pie). It has a classic Italian touch to it but not as thin; more of a hybrid between the thin Italian and doughy New York.

Mr62XbCUHL7n6L_G53SQHQ.text: My boss used Il Bosco to cater a function we were hosting at his house.  They brought a 900-degree brick wood burning pizza oven on wheels to his house, and made the pizzas fresh.  It was all very cool!  With a staff of 3 (2 people making pizzas and one person serving as a "hostess") and enough pizza to serve 20-30 people, the cost was $750.  They also throw in Caesar salad, which was really tasty!  The couple of pizzas I tried were all very well made and tasted really good.  My only gripe was that they charged a $150 "service fee" (which is in addition to any gratuities given to the staff), which was not disclosed at any point during the reservation process.  Other than that, the experience was flawless!

749iEGoEGWEa9EWS1N2Q9Q.text: I work in this area and have visited most of the local restaurants in the past few years. Came in at 2pm for a late lunch on a Friday and ordered the Lucia (sausage and mushrooms). Once the pizza is prepared, it takes 90 seconds to cook in the 700 degree pizza oven. For me, the amount of pizza was perfect. Great flavors, cheese, and sausage. I was also served a small dish of olives which they brine themselves...tasty. To drink I had a red birch beer...very tasty too. The pizza was $7 and a couple of bucks for the birch beer. Very reasonable for lunch in this area.   I'll be back.;)
